135133.content:
I'm in for a rude awakening. As I'm sleeping underneath the hide blankets, I'm unable to detect the throng of people stomping down the hallway and into the room I'm sleeping in. I'm unable to defend myself or escape the strong clutches of a large-muscled man, who easily pulls me by my wrists out of the bed and onto the smooth rocky floor. They tie a gag into my mouth which is soaked in something that seems to impair all of my senses. By now, even before to place a shroud over my head and wrap me another, coarser sheet of hide and secure me with ropes, I'm numb to it all. The vision that I see when sound bounces off objects is the least impaired. The strong man easily drapes me over his shoulder and takes me out of the cavern.

The group of people laugh and snigger and use a tongue that I'm not familiar with. They take me out of the complex system of caverns and outside, where what looks like wolves are saddled, waiting for the riders. I don't know what purpose they have for me or if Dezra was the one pulling the strings. The strong man takes me to his wolf, which is much bigger than the rest and he drapes me on a blanket immediately behind the main saddle. After straddling his wolf, the beast struggles to get on its front legs before getting on its hind legs, which lift me up.

The leader, who shouts to the group and gives me his position at the front of the pack, kicks his wolf into motion and the rest follow. Unlike horses, when the wolves get up to speed, there isn't much turbulence even when the paws hit the ground. I would expect myself to bob up and down, but on this beast's hind quarters, I'm almost relatively still.

They ride effortlessly out of what looks like the beginning of a desert to the foot of the hills. When trees start to sprout up in huge numbers, the pack's speed lessens, but their swiftness in navigating the windy dirt paths do not fail. Eventually a clearing opens up and less and less trees are found in my audible vision. Upright structures like log cabins start to spring up and I can tell we enter what seems to be a forest town. The vastness of this town starts to reveal itself as the activities start to increase as we get deeper. By now, the riders have dismounted their wolves and the strong man again carries me over his shoulder as his brethren escort their bounty through an increasing crowd of people. Such examples look to be prostitutes and mercenary alike. Either someone has their skin exposed or there is a bladed weapon hidden on them.

The amount of activity give me a broader picture of the town around me. Even with my eyes closed underneath this shroud, I can see as far as thirty feet in front of me. The band of riders seem to be taking me to the biggest building in the town. I assume at first that it's like a police station and as an Amaranthine, these people have come to exchange me for a reward. It's only after we enter that my assumptions are rendered false. It's far from a city hall or a police station. It's actually a large tavern which also serves as a bordello.

"Madame Rose!" the strong man calls out. His voice is so thunderous, I can feel it through his chest and shoulders.

A lithe woman dressed in a flamboyant dress comes near and greets the men, "The brothers of the Gold Mane tribe. Here to close out my tavern again. Where is Master Dezra?" the woman speaks with such elegance.

"He is away to tend to the rest of the tribe. We had nothing to do, so we set out to find your find establishment. We've traveled long distance to get here, Madame. I hope you'll cater to our needs very well," the leader of the pack speaks. Somehow, I know he is lying about Dezra.

"Is it drink or flesh that you boys will be needing tonight?" the Madame speaks without hesitation.

"Less of the flesh and more of the drink. If possible, we'd like your barrels to overflow into our goblets," the leader says.

"We may run out at this rate, but anything for you, Master Lotta," the Madame finishes and drifts away from my vision. I'm virtually ignored, though I can sense many eyes looking toward the person wrapped in ropes and covered with a shroud.

I'm seated on a bench next to the strong man. Sometimes he accidentally spills what smells like fragrant wine and bitter beer on me, though sometimes, I feel like it's more intentional and done for laughs. He also fondles me and pokes me in places that are more sensitive than my arms and legs. I want to scream, but this gag and the drink mixed with whatever substance the gag was soaked in further impairs me. I'm simply a log covered in wine and ropes. The festivities are long and soon, as the night draws to a close, most of the patrons have left and the activities start to quiet down. The pack is still here and a familiar voice speaks once more.

"We will be closing soon. Since Master Dezra isn't here, can I expect anyone else to pay the lofty bill?" she asks.

"You've caught us, Madame. We were riding light in order to catch your late night servings of drink. We have not a single coin on us," the leader speaks.

"Then shall I put it on Master Dezra's tab or will you be willing to help out with the chores so you can pay for your drinks?" the Madame suggests.

"Do not trouble him with an unexpected bill if he dare come into your wonderful establishment. Then again, I think we are too tired to even lift a finger for you, though we do have a bargaining chip," the leader explains. "Butch, if you will."

The strong man uncovers the shroud over my head and exposed my sweaty and wine-soaked head and hair. With no regular patrons looking, the gag in my mouth is not a sight that's inappropriate to see, not that I can see any faraway reactions.

"Again, we won't be lifting a finger for you, Madame, but you may employ her to earn back our tab. She is but a gentle Amaranthine hybrid. She's blind, but don't let that stop her from helping you. So Madame, what do you say?" the master explains and finishes with an offer.

"What shall I do with her after she's earn the funds for your bill?" the Madame asks.

"Do with her however you see fit. If she's capable, employ her further. If not, then you can throw her out with the trash. I'll leave her fate completely up to you," the master says and gets up from his seat. The others stand too including the strong man, who pushes me off the bench and onto my back on the floor. In no time at all, all that is left in the tavern is myself on the floor and the Madame standing quietly to the side. The clinking of a metal goblet can be heard echoing in the background, but I assume it's a waitress doing the dishes.

The click of boot heels sound from the floor and I can feel the vibrations through the floorboards. The Madame squats down and when she speaks, I can see her face right above me. "I'm the kind of person who will give you a choice once your debt has been paid. I have no desire to throw you out like a dog and if you feel like you would like to work for me for longer than your debt allows, then I shall happily employ your skills, whatever they may be. For now, you shall be put to work."

Just what kind of work am I in for?

1351331.content:
Another set of footsteps walk onto the floor from the direction of the front door. The Madame notices the visitor and she greets him and apologizes. "I'm sorry Sir, we have run dry of drink and the doves have worked so hard they are in their nests," the Madame says.

"I was just passing through, Madame," the visitor speaks, but his voice is so low that I can barely hear him. "I could not help but overhear, but it seems the mass of desert dwellers that just left paid the bill with this bounty that is laying on your tavern floor."

"Yes. She's a poor thing, possibly taken captive from an Amaranthine camp. I hear she is a hybrid, who does not have the ability to sense much. She is also blind it seems," the Madame explains.

"She doesn't look like much of a worker and I have never heard of such a thing as a blind dove. I find she is not much use to you it seems," the visitor says.

"I have my avenues of having her earn her keep, but it seems you are interested in her. I can sell her to you, for a price," the Madame says.

"How much is her debt?" the man asks.

"Those men order many drinks, enough to kill a dozen Dire Wolves. I'd say she would work for my establishment for a total of a month and a half. I would say the price for this girl is a politician's weekly salary," the Madame says. However large that amount is, is beyond my comprehension.

"A hefty fee, but you are in luck, Madame," the visitor says confidently. "I have been looking for servant and I do have the coin to exchange for the girl and then some. I shall get the funds while you clean her up and dress her with a one of those keyed belts. Also a cloak and the bottom of your barrels. I shall have a drink before I set off."

Nothing more is said and I hear the visitor and the Madame leave from me. In no time, two pairs of feet walk over to me and get me upright. There is no pleasure reserved for me and my bath is short-lived. I'm clothed in skimpy leather underwear and boots are placed on my feet along with metal cuffs that are tightly bound to my wrists and ankles. A collar is fastened around my neck as well. Lastly, my crotch and pelvic area is adorned with a leather panty which is more heavier than the cuffs and collar combined. Even though it has a massive weight, it fits snug on my body. A key is placed into the hole of a padlock that sit in front of my pelvis. When it is turned and locked, the metallic belt around my waist cinches, somewhat like what a corset could do. There is slight discomfort in wearing it. To cover the rest of my body, the hands put me in a robe with long sleeves, like that of a monk. Once I'm clothed, I'm escorted out back into the tavern.

"Ah, here she is and in no time at all," the voice of the Madame speaks.

"Such a beautiful specimen to add. Pity she cannot see her own beauty. And no cloak? That robe would have to do," the visitor says.

"And as you requested, the key to her love, and twelve goblets of the leftovers. On the house of course," the Madame says.

"You may leave us, Madame. I wish to acquaint myself with my servant," the visitor tells the Madame. I hear her leave along with the others. The man leads me to a nearby bench and allows me to sit without telling me audibly. He sits next to me and rather close. An arm wraps around my torso and easily, he reaches in between my legs. If it weren't for the chastity belt, he would have already claimed a prize. "For an Amaranthine, you are surprisingly calm, even with my hand over here. I wish not to violate you and I have purchase that belt for your safety, even from me. Your looks, your beauty. Even though your blood is violet, you tempt me like a human woman. You can relax when you are with me. On paper you are my slave, but in my terms, I am your savior. I shall finish my drink and then we'll be off. And one thing, what is your name?"

Should I give him the name Dezra named me after? Or, since I'm now a slave, my master gets to name me?

13513313.content:
I choose to give him my name, but he places a hand on my wrist. "Silence," he whispers as he puts his lips to the rim of a goblet. What has alarmed him is the presence of two other visitors and by the sounds they make, I can tell they are clad in armor. The clicks of the Madame's heels pass our table and meet with the men. What seems like ten minutes pass by and my hand start to tremble. My master's hand grasps my hands and calms them down. "Farewell Master Dezra," the Madame says and I'm surprised to hear the name of my master is none other than the one who kept me in his cavern room.

We swiftly exit the tavern, finding the weather has took a turn for the worst. The sound of thunder rumbles throughout the sky and rain pours from he heavens in a vertical deluge. The strong winds pushes the drops sideways and quickly soak our clothes. Being almost naked underneath, I push my robe tighter against my body, hoping to stay warm. Master Dezra leads me to a large mound of what seems to be fur, since it doesn't sound like a wagon or cart and with the raindrops making a large amount of sounds to create a clear picture for me. The beast of a mound wakes up and it turns out to be a large wolf. Like a dog, it sheds the moisture from its fur and expels it outward, further soaking us to the bone.

With no obstacles in the way, the wolf in no time speeds up to what could be a wolf-like gallop to the edge of the town. To escape the rain, Dezra navigates his wolf to an abandoned cliffside cavern. He helps me off of the wolf, which again dries itself by shaking the moisture from its fur. It follows us deeper into the cave and into an open room. The sound of fire crackling is heard and the sound is enough to show me briefly two other persons in the cave.

"I liked that cavern. Dry. I hate the rain," Amersh mentions.

"Get used to it," Dezra says. "Zephyra. Why don't we find you a place to rest. I managed to retrieve my hide blankets from the room, but I had to leave in a hurry." Dezra leads me to a room that seems to be smaller than that previous one he had me in. He helps me from my cloak and also removes the cuffs and collar from me. He leaves the belt though, since he said it is for my safety and to waive off his temptation. "You can relax now. If you need me, just call."

I wring out the moisture from my hair as best as I can and climb underneath the covers, letting the blankets warm me up. Eventually, I fall back into slumber.

Are you familiar with the feeling you get when you mistakenly doze off while sitting down? Where you are expected to have a straight posture, but due to fatigue or any other source of something that makes you fall asleep, you start to lean a certain way. But when you hit that certain limit or angle, you are woken up by your own throat, leading to awkward looks from anybody watching?

That's what happened to me. I remember getting slapped by a hand, but I don't know what for. I find myself in shock that I cannot remember any events prior to me waking up here in this... waiting room?

The people in the room sitting down in the seats set up into rows against the walls only momentarily look at me like I'm some freak who doesn't get any sleep. The next moment, they glance the other way, with no concern for me on their faces. They all look young too, or at least, around the same age as me. I feel no change to my body whatsoever. I'm the same Cesar as I was last time I remember, but still, I don't recall why I got slapped several hours ago.

A door opens and all eyes, including mine, pay their gaze at the open door. A woman dressed in clothes most secretaries wear comes out with a clipboard. She looks about the room and utters a name, "Cesar?"

I stand up, albeit awkwardly, since the same guy who awkwardly made a weird sound while he was sleeping is the same guy being called up. I follow the woman through the doorway and she leads me into another door, just a few steps away from the first. She allows me to enter the door once it's open and I walk inside. Immediately, I see two men dressed in military fatigues and a man sitting behind the desk situated in the middle of the room.

"Cesar, take a seat," the man says, gesturing to a chair on the opposite side of his desk. The woman silent walks around the desk to an empty seat next to the man. "How are you feeling?"

"Good, I guess," I answer.

"Are you sure of your decision to donate your body for the greater good?" the man asks.

"Donate my body?" I ask, in confusion.

"You must be aware what you're subjecting your body to, or were you ignorant in that regard?" the man mentions.

"Sir, this one was chosen from the first pool of volunteers. Surely, he probably doesn't even remember putting his name in the ballot," the woman speaks up, her gentle voice calming the man down. "If you allow me, I can refresh his memory." The man gestures his head as a go-ahead for the woman to start explaining. "Mr. Cesar," she addresses me now, getting to her feet as well. "It has been over a year or so, but you volunteered to donate your body in exchange for a hefty sum being transferred to your bank account. What we to do with your body? Not store it of course. Let me pitch it to you in one example. This here is Lieutenant Thomas Greaves. He is a Army veteran who served in many confrontations with ISIS. He was actually an EOD specialist, dealing with lethal explosives buried underneath roads in the deserts and cities. He was doing well until he accidentally stepped on a landmine. He was able to survive by diving to the side, but in his effort, the explosive maimed his right leg from the knee down. He decided to amputate."

The man standing to the left lifts his pant leg up and reveals a prosthetic leg mainly built with carbon fiber parts.

"This is where you come in. There are many people who are physically able to serve in the military, but their mental aptitude prevents them from becoming the best soldiers. We want to minimize casualties, but we also don't want to force people into signing up for the armed forces. With your donated body, we can temporarily transfer your consciousness into a bank, where you will lie dormant for however long you sign up for and then we can transfer Lt. Greaves or anybody else in need of a better body, transfer their consciousness into your body where they can use it to the best of their abilities."

A question comes up, "What if I don't want my body to be subjected to that type of activity?"

"When you sign up, you have the ability to sign up for only a certain kind of activity. But, with less risk, comes a lesser paycheck at the end. It's all up to you," the woman says, sitting back down.

"How long would I have to do this for?" I ask.

"However long you want. You can sign up for week-long donation, month-long donation, or even year-long donations. You can also set it at random where we can use your body as often as it is available. Just note, that with year-long and random stints, we may have to transfer your consciousness into a temporary body, so as you mind doesn't go mad from waiting, not that there is any wait while you are dormant," the woman says, her gentle voice also calming my concerns.

The man speaks up and hands me a clipboard with a multi-page document. "Here is your form. Be specific with the option that are given. Just keep in mind that if you select more options, more funds will be transferred to your bank account."

What should I sign up for?

13533322.content:
I turn to my right down the rest of the hallway and through the door to the master bedroom. When I enter, I find that the room looks nothing like the room my parents dwelt in. I expected to find pictures of them hanging on the walls and also pictures of the whole family sitting on the nightstands, but instead I find nothing. The furniture is there, including a king-sized bed, a desk with a desktop computer on it, a couple dressers and nightstands flanking the bed. But nothing noting that there is someone using this room. The room looks more like a hotel room than someone's room.

I exit out of the room right when I hear something. When I get to the hallway, I hear the sounds are coming from the first floor. I look down from over the banister and find that the sounds are coming from the front door. I wait and watch and soon enough, the front door opens. Who comes in?
13533322.title: No Sign of My Folks

choices: He demands to know who I am and what I am doing here
He pauses for a moment, but then remembers something
He's apologetic and asks me about my well-being
135333221.content:
When the front door opens, a man who looks to be in his late twenties walks in. In his hands are a couple boxes, one large and one small sitting on top of if. He puts the boxes down and goes back outside, only to come back into the house carrying a bunch of bags, one of which is a backpack, while the rest are groceries by the looks of them. He sets them down right next to the boxes while he carries his backpack to one of the couches to set it down on the cushions.

He lets out a sigh of relief before sitting himself down on the couch. He pulls out his cell phone and take a look at it. It's at this time his eyes slowly rise from his phone to the second floor banister. He notices me, in my pink nightie, leaning against the banister. He squints his eyes as if trying to recognize me. He then gets up, alert. How does he react the second after?
135333221.title: Mr. Supervisor

choices: Snatch the paper from his hand and demand an answer
Politely ask if he's ready
Don't speak at all and walk away
1353332211.content:
Once his eyes catch a glimpse, they focus on me like lasers intent to burn right through my body. With a stern voice, he asks, "Who are you? What are you doing here?"

I'm quite shocked at his reaction. If I was still a man and in his shoes, I would be shocked that there would be a woman, especially in a nightgown, present in my house. I struggle to answer, which comes out as a stammer due to nervousness. "I'm... I live here," I tell him, but since I'm still shocked and growing to be offended by his reaction, I shoot the question back at him. "Wait, who are you then and why do you have keys to my house?"

"Your house?" he asks, bewildered that I would ask such a question. "Since I have the keys, clearly this house belongs to me."

"If you're going to fight, at least have the decency to close the door so you don't disturb your neighbor, son," says a bald, black man wearing a bright Hawaiian flower shirt, who appears outside the open door. Both the man's and my attention shift to the man. "I don't mean to pry, but don't you ever read your mail?" The man asks before handing the younger man a parcel.

I take this opportunity to make my way down the stairs to the lower floor. With the door open, a slight breeze enters the house. Though it''s warm at first, with the amount of skin that is exposed on my unfamiliar female body, it quickly turns into a cooler draft that causes me to shiver. I try to wrap my arms around my body but it's no use.

The man looks at the front of the parcel. Just by reading the sender's address, he curses under his breath, "Shit, I forgotten all about this." He quickly opens the parcels in order to read the contents inside.

While he's doing that, the black man looks over to me and sees me shivering in the cold. "Hey miss, you know you should cover up if you ever have an open door. It's hot today, but, soon the days will get colder. You know, these boxes that the young man has brought in are actually for you. He can explain in detail later, but first, let's get something for you to cover up," he explains. The black man goes over to the boxes that are left in the foyer and immediately opens the larger of the two with his big hands. From my position, once he opens the box, I can see various amount of fabric inside. He immediately takes out a flimsy black garment and tosses it to me. I unwrap the balled-up garment and after finding the tag and sleeves, at once I realize what it is. I look up at the black man. In defense, he tells me, "It's better than what you have on right now."

Without saying anything, I insert my arms into the rather large sleeve and wrap the sides to my body. An added rope made of a thicker version of the original fabric is included and I use that to cinch the garment to my body. Once the tie has been fasten, I realize the garment is a bathrobe. Even though I can barely feel the garment on my body, since it covers my arms, torso and the bottom of my nightgown, I'm protected from the cold breeze coming in. My legs still feel cold, but it's bearable.

"Are you done reading that, young man?" the black man then asks the other man.

The younger man looks up from the multi-page letter and says, "They didn't notify me that she was coming today."

"Maybe it's because you were so busy that you didn't even notice. Don't think I don't notice my young neighbor getting so caught up in his personal matters that he ignores everything else around him," the black man says. "I'm going to take my leave and leave you two to sort out your situation." With that, the black man leave, closing the door behind him, leaving the two of us still in the living room.

I stare at the man, but he dares not to look back at me. All his eyes do is look up and down on the paper he's holding, hoping to find an answer on the very page he's on, even though he's only on the second page. I need to get his attention, but how should I do it?
1353332211.title: Who Are You?

choices: Knock on the door
Listen in to his phone conversation
Leave the area
13533322111.content:
Without warning him, I step up to the man and grab the top of the packet of papers and pull it toward me. My action surely gets his attention and at once, in a manner of seconds, he looks up from the text and stares into my face. His grip on the papers tighten and he pulls the papers back towards him. When that happens, my grip on the papers tighten as well and our fight from earlier recommences. A fierceness appears on the man's face which I assume is on my face as well. Instead of words like curses or insults, the only sounds that comes out of our mouths are groans, his being of the deeper variety and mine a higher kind. This tug o' war would go on and on, but with the flimsiness of paper and how very weak it is to sheer forces twisting and pulling it apart, the battle would end very soon.

I give the packet one last pull, which causes it to give way and tear all seven pages of it at the area where it was lightly folded in order to put it in the envelope. With only one direction the force of my pull could go, I'm sent falling backward, eventually landing on my ass, which considering how hard I pulled, hurts me a bit.

The man on the other hand has good balance and stays on his feet as his half of the packet stays in his hands. His anger, for some reason, boils to a rage and he approaches me suddenly and furiously asks, "What the fuck did you do that for?" He points to the clean tear along his half of the packet, as if I'm the sole person who committed it. Yes, I may have instigated it, but his reaction was more than I expected it to be. "I've already had a bad day today and these boxes, this message and most of all, YOU, just makes it a whole lot worse!" He angrily throws his half of the packet towards me, sending it flying roughly into my lap. Still in his rage, he storms off upstairs. I look up and he passes my room into where the master bedroom would be. Like a teenage tantrum, he slams the door with enough force to shake the banister.

His shouting is like my father's, but since it's directly sent to me, my emotions get the best of me. When he emphasizes YOU in his sentence and using the packet as a pointer, it hit me at that moment. I froze, like how a dog does when it's ready to receive punishment for doing something wrong. I couldn't retaliate or say anything back in return. Plus, the pain in my ass grew more throbbed with soreness as I sat there take the verbal blows. Slowly, the tears start to appear. Unfamiliar with a female's sensitivity to conflict like we just had, I have no explanation why my tears fall so easily. With no reason I can think of, I sob right there in that living room, using my large sleeve to constantly dry my eyes and cheeks. All I can do is cry and I find I have no ability to shout or even speak.

After five minutes or so of the waterworks, I gather myself as well as the two halves of the packet. For no apparent reason, I somehow have this heavy burden of guilt, as if my body has already admitted my fault, despite my current male mind thinking otherwise. I pick up the two halves of the packet and get to my feet. I make my way upstairs and navigate to the closed door of the master bedroom. Behind the door, I can hear the man inside venting his anger through his mouth as if he is doing it by shouting at someone else on a phone. Who can he be talking to? I look at the two bundles of paper in my hands and again, my body connects the ripping of the packet to the guilt weighing on my shoulders. I take a deep breath in order to keep myself from crying again. Since it was my fault that I tried to take the packet away from the man and that it was my last pull that ripped it in half, I should act in such a way that is completely different that the initial action. We might have another fight if I do the same.

I go for the door knob, but stop as I realize something. Barging in unannounced would be similar, if not the same, as pulling on the packet without asking first. I should knock before entering. What should I do?
13533322111.title: Tug o' War

choices: Leave before I'm caught
The man suddenly opens the door, catching me listening in
I knock on the door in order to disguise my eavesdropping
135333221112.content:
I raise my hand, balled into a fist so that my knuckles would have enough force behind them to generate a knock loud enough to overpower the volume of the man's voice. Though, instead of rapping against the door, I decide to listen in on the conversation.

The man shouts, "I did not sign up for this job! I want my old position back!" A brief pause ensues before he speaks up again. "For how long? Six months? I can't wait six months? What am I supposed to do?"

It seems I've eavesdropped on a moment in his phone call that has a possibility of escalating. I can stand there, but I run the risk of being caught in the act of eavesdropping if he suddenly opens the door. Before that happens I can just leave. What should I do?
135333221112.title: Eavesdropping

choices: Give back the packet in person and apologize
Slip the packet underneath the door
Before I can do anything, Mr. Reed comes out of the master bedroom
1353332211121.content:
I step back from the door and since it's close, I slip into my room before the door can potentially open. I close the door behind me. In the calmness of my room, I can still hear the man yelling into his phone, but his shouts soon cease. In my time being a male, I've never seen anyone get angry that quickly and that intense before. Yes, I may have seen videos of people having tantrums or meltdowns, but to see it and experience it in person is quite different. The guilt of causing the paper to rip and send this man into a furious rage still lingers in my chest, but it seems the answer to his tension may be in the pieces of paper I brought with me.

I take a seat on my bed and start reading. From what I can make out and understand is that I'm a charge, or someone who is put under the supervision of a Benefactor. The man in the next room is supposed to an Acting Benefactor. I'm shocked to read that the original Benefactor would have been my father, but there is no written reason why he isn't at the moment. Despite knowing my father having the same kind of short temper, I can honestly say that I'd rather be a charge under him than the man in the next room.

The man, the Acting Benefactor, whose name is referred to as Mr. Reed, was formally selected by his colleague to perform a favor. Due to personal issues, his colleague was unable to look after the house of the original Benefactor. The company that had sent Mr. Reed, also had assigned him a charge, me, that he would have to temporarily be a Benefactor towards. They have noted his objections, but they haven't given Mr. Reed his wishes due to the temporary assignment. Somehow the guilt lingering within seems to die down, but not by much.

I take the pages and exit my room. Since I've already read the packet, I might as well give it back to Mr. Reed, since it was his to begin with. Should I give it to him in person and while I'm there, I could apologize for my behavior? Or should I just slip it underneath the door and don't bother apologizing, since he will have his packet back? How should I go about doing this?
1353332211121.title: Retreat

choices: Insist that he and I should watch it
Listen to his advice and refuse to watch it
Listen to his advice, but watch it without him
13533322111213.content:
I slowly walk up to the door and I raise my hand to knock on it. Before my knuckles reach the white surface, it pulls away from my hand. The door is opened and none other than Mr. Reed is there behind it. He's no longer wearing his semi-formal attire, instead he's wearing comfortable clothing; a hoodie and sweat pants. He looks like he's changed into garments for exercising. It looks as if he's calmed down a bit, but since my head is lowered, I can't tell if he has an angry face. "Can I help you?" he asks.

I don't say anything, instead I raise the hand holding the two halves of the packet he was reading. He promptly takes it, without any resistance from me.

"Did you read it?" he asks. I don't answer. He doesn't get mad, to my surprise. "Then you should already know of my... our... situation here."

"Sorry," I simply say, finding it difficult to find words to properly apologize for my behavior.

"For what?" he asks.

"I acted like a bitch earlier and I ripped your letter," I tell him, not daring to look up at him.

As I stare down at my toes, Mr. Reed moves, but I don't know in what way. For all I know, he could be ready to retaliate and deliver a well-deserved slap to my face. Or he could pull me into his room, close the door behind him, and take advantage of the contrasts of our strengths. Instead he surprises me by taking my wrist and pulling me down the hallway. I don't protest (in fact, I don't have a moment to protest) as he pulls me down the stairs to the first floor. He takes me to the front door, where we both had our furies entangled with one another. I can only think of one thing that he could do at this moment and that is to kick me out of the house.

Surprisingly, he doesn't do anything of the sort. He turns me around so that I'm now facing him and lifts my face by my chin. I witness a stoic face on Mr. Reed, before he speaks up to say, "Six months they said. Six months I will have to wait until they can reassign me. Until then, I will have to watch over you. I don't want to. I'm not a babysitter. I'm sure I'm no Benefactor. Didn't sign up to be one. They just put you in my lap, expecting me to take care of you." His rant has a bit of a negative tone and it doesn't benefit me or put me in a good light. It's as if I'm a burden to him. "So I'd like to make an agreement. For the next six months, I don't want to be responsible for you. I can help you a little, but I'm not going to do things for you. Basically, I live my life and you live yours. We don't need to interact at all. We'll just get into fights. Consider the two of us as housemates who had no interest in each other. That way, everyone stays happy. Agree?"

"Sounds good to me, I guess," I say to his face.

"Good. So this agreement, it starts after we clean this place up. Since I've found that these boxes, which belong to you, to be too heavy for you to carry, I'll go ahead and bring it to your room. What you can do is get the groceries and put them into the refrigerator. Sounds easy?" he asks. I nod and without another word, he goes to pick up his backpack, slinging each strap over each of his shoulder. He then uses his legs to squat before wrapping arms around the larger of the two boxes. His extends his legs, enabling him to lift the heavy boxes without throwing out his back. Mr. Reed swiftly walks the boxes to the steps and begins ascending them.

I take this time to gather all of the plastic bags and carry them to the kitchen. I would have been able to get all of the bags, totaling ten, all at once, but that would need the strength of a man, which I'm surely am not. I have to take about three trips back and forth just to get them all into the kitchen. Once the bags are transferred, I open up the refrigerator and find an almost empty fridge compartment. The only things I find is a couple of beer bottles, shredded cheese, and an apple.

For some reason, I have a desire to ask why the fridge is empty, but after remembering what Mr. Reed said what would start after cleaning up, I decide otherwise. I just start filling up the refrigerator with the items in the plastic bags. A gallon of milk and a gallon of orange juice on the top shelf; a pack of shredded mozzarella cheese and a pack of sliced cheddar cheese on the shelf below that; and an assortment of fruits and vegetables in a drawer below the second shelf. For the dry goods, I simply take them out of the bags and set them on the kitchen table. I fold the plastic bags into plastic folded footballs and set them aside, just in case Mr. Reed needs them later.

I make my way upstairs and find Mr. Reed removing garments from the larger box and placing them on my bed. He speaks as if he already knows I'm here, despite his back being turned to me. "It would have been better if you made your bed yourself," he remarks, "but I can understand if that's a old habit of yours, consider the route you took."

"Route?" I ask. "What's that supposed to mean?"

Mr. Reed takes the smaller of the two boxes and brings it to me. It's already open. "Here's all the material you need to make sense of your situation. Identification card, credit and debit cards, and important paperwork," he explains. I open the box to find all the item he told me was inside the box. More items included is a leather wallet to hold the aforementioned cards and a compact disc. I take it out and show it to Mr. Reed.

"What's this supposed to be?" I ask.

"An introduction. Basically, everything the paperwork will tell you. You don't need to watch it, really," he tells me.

I flip the case over and a printed note is held behind the plastic. "Dear Benefactor, Please make sure to watch this with your charge," the note reads.

"But it says here that you have to watch it with your charge," I tell him.

"Didn't I say that you don't have to watch it? Take it from me, who has seen the video before," he explains after raising him voice.

He says not to watch it, but for some reason I do. Do I take his advice and not watch or should I insist?
13533322111213.title: Caught

choices: He tells me the truth about what is shown next; about wayward Charges
Before he can say anything, I suffer from a throbbing headache and nosebleed
He tries to begin, but the video continues to play out silently
135333221112133.content:
"I suggest you just throw the DVD away, as it's all in the paperwork," he continues to tell me as he makes his exit. "You don't want to watch the end, which is why it recommended me to watch with you. All I can say is that it's graphic and may disturb you."

He closes the door behind him and I'm left with a choice. Since curiosity has had its grasp on me ever since laying eyes on the disc's case, I make sure Mr. Reed is not standing outside the door. I find a DVD player and turn on the television. To make sure Mr. Reed doesn't hear anything, I find an old pair of headphones and plug it into an audio jack. Although the cord is too short for me to extend back so I'm not in an IMAX-Theater situation, I opt to just stand and watch as the video immediately begin with no DVD menu.

The video starts with a history lesson, which recalls a debilitating disease that affected about 75% of the total women in the world over the age of 25 last year. Most of the those affected were in fully-developed nations, with North America, South America, Japan, metropolitan China, and the greater continent of Europe being the top five. There was no known cure and by June of this year, about 90% of the women affected died, with the rest becoming bedridden in a coma. As mind-boggling as it my seem, I somehow believe the history that the video presents is true. If not, why would there be a law like the Apathy Clause

The video goes on to a recent act or clause that was enacted concerning the well-being and economy of all the nations. For some odd reason, the people (which refers to the upper class, upper-middle class and elites of these nations), believe that the homeless, the criminals in our prisons and all of the apathetic young adults living in our communities are not contributing their share to the well-being of their resident nations. They say homeless people are living carefree, only living on handouts, never giving anything in return. They only make beautiful places their trash bin. Criminals get three square meals a day and are housed with beds and a roof over their heads, as well as exercise and education, all for free and we, the taxpayers, are paying for so-called freedom behind ten feet of concrete. Young adults nowadays are so unmotivated that they live off their parents, the ones who have toiled and broke their backs for them. They ruin their own futures and therefore ruin the futures of the younger generations. It was finally time for a change.

The change came with an Apathy Clause, which is actually geared more for young adults between the ages of 18 and 24. In addition, it only pertains to males, who are viewed as the head of households. Women, on the other hand, if in a relationship with a man or are independent with a decent job to maintain modest living for themselves and anybody in their household or are under responsibility of their fathers, is able to go about as they please and are not put under the Clause. Men who have graduated high school are therefore given a deadline at their 25th birthday. They are free to employ themselves in a job or career and are also encourage to go to college in hopes to get a job after graduation. Those in school are given deadlines after four years, six and even eight years for those in the medical field. For those in school, if they cannot keep a 2.0 GPA during their semesters, they are immediately withdrawn from school and put under the Apathy Clause. If they do graduate, but are not able to get employed six months after graduation, they too are put under the Apathy Clause. Same goes for those who have been employed before their 25th birthday. If they are somehow fired or their job terminates and cannot re-employ themselves after six months, they too are put under the Apathy Clause. This has all be enacted in efforts to de-saturate the competition in the job market. Hope goes to those who can achieve their dreams. To those cannot, must take a different route.

Under the Apathy Clause, the different route comes with gender modification. In an effort to battle the incurable disease that only affects women, the top governments have started to modify the genders of men who are under the Apathy Clause. Since these new women were initially men, they are immune to the disease. All throughout, the gender change is emphasized as a choice. If you choose to go through with it, your gender is changed and your are put in the responsibility to the closest male family member or legal guardian who can afford to put you under his roof. If there is none, then one is appointed to take responsibility for you. Unfortunately, if there is no family, friend, guardian or even a government-appointed guardian to take responsibility for you, then you are sent to an unclaimed pool, which includes those who refused or chose against the Clause's requirements. Instead of a gentle transformation, those who refused or chose against were forced to change regardless. The pool are then used for ill reasons that the presentation does not disclose.

The presentation goes on to describe what has happened, which it reiterates is all of our choosing. There is two routes where we can be changed. We can either have our minds, or as the presentations puts it, souls, from our male bodies into female bodies custom-made by our guardians, or have ourselves subjected to a chemical change, where hormones and other substances are used to literally change our genders at the microscopic level. The latter process takes more time, which also is more painful, but the end product is a body that feels much more in terms of sensations. One can say that senses in the body of the latter process are heightened a bit.



The next part of the video is life after the change, which informs that when we are changed, the drastic modification of the physical may affect the memory of the individual going through the change. Since clients are given anesthesia that last for four to six months, most will wake up a month or more after the procedure is done. As the client is still under the effects of the drug, they are carefully delivered to the place of their residence. A technician will monitor the client, making sure vitals stay within desired range. In some cases, clients are given a chemical that counter-acts the effect of the anesthesia, though clients will not wake fully until two to three days after administering the counter-acting drug, with two being the average. When the client finally wakes up, it would feel like she does not remember anything save for a bit. This is usual since the anesthesia more or less disconnects the mind and memory, which may remember the body being male, from the body, which is drastically changed. Memories would start to gradually emerge as each day passes, totaling a maximum of five days, which makes the process last a week, though in some cases, memories start to flare up in just a day.

The video, for the first time, addresses the witness or guardian, but before that can happen, the headphones are pulled from my ears, replacing the pleasant music with the sound of my silent room and an angry Mr. Reed. "Didn't I tell you not to watch it?!" he loudly remind me. "And with earphones?" he tosses the earbuds towards the door, which pathetically makes impact with the with surface before quietly clattering to the floor.

The pain from having the earbuds being ripped out of my ears none other by Mr. Reed, who got me mad last time due to him ignoring me, continues to linger and it pushes me over the line again and I blow my top. I get into his face, equally shouting, "What the fuck did you do that for, motherfucker?" My question ends with a quick slap to his face, which seems to quiet him down. He reels back and places a hand on the wall for support. His other hand favors the cheek that I had slapped, which I can feel already on my own hand,

In a lower, less angry voice, he explains, "There is something I didn't tell you about what happens next?" This garners my interest and I calm down enough to take a breath and take a seat on the bed.

"What is it?" I ask.
135333221112133.title: Point Blank Lie

choices: He's currently in the shower
He's somewhere else in the house
He's laying right next to me, fast asleep
1353332211121332.content:
"What happens is..." Mr. Reed starts, but doesn't quite have the words he needs to explain any further.

"What hap-" I try to motivate him to begin again, but right as I begin to speak, a piercing pain erupts in my forehead and I immediately press a hand in an effort to alleviate the pressure, which seems to build instead of subside.

"Oh no, not this early," he says, but I can barely make out any more. As the pain in my head increases, so does the reverberation in my ears. It's as if someone had pulled the pin out of a grenade and left it in the room. Even though the explosion was never to be seen or heard, the after effects were evident in that my ears are deafened. My sense of sight and hearing is rendered useless and my sense of touch is intensified, more so around my head. I can feel Mr. Reed rush to me to keep myself from collapsing and hitting my head.

As Mr. Reed picks me up with his arms, I cannot do much other than let him do what he needs in order to put me in a better position. As he carries me out of the room, my hands still clutch at my head, in a futile attempt to press the stinging pain out like you would when pushing the bubbles out from under a cell phone's screen protector. The sting quickly becomes a deafening ring that drowns out even the sensation I feel physically. What I lose in physical touch, I gain in a deluge of images flashing through my mind. Even though they speed past a figurative sight of my two eyes, my mind starts to connect them to form a memory. The flood soon becomes a tidal wave that threatens to overcome me, sweep me away into the farthest reaches of my subconscious.

Fortunately, I wake up before it does. I find a warm towel on my forehead and I'm no longer in my room. I'm laying on the bed in the master bedroom. Don't tell me that it's the very same bed that Mr. Reed sleeps in. I sit up rather quickly, which doesn't let the blood catch up, so in effect, I get light-headed. The pain returns to my head, but not in its extreme form. It does cause me to remember a moment from a particular time. To the time when I was still a man. I had received a visit from a man, telling me of a new law, an Apathy Clause, the very same one that was presented in the video. He tells me that I'm way past the deadline and have to subject myself to the consequences. I make the decision without any protest or resistance. I wonder what convinced me to make a decision that quickly. Maybe it's due to what Mr. Reed was trying to prevent me from seeing at the end of the video?

Where is Mr. Reed anyways?
1353332211121332.title: Skull Splitter

choices: Nearsighted
13533322111213322.content:
Mr. Reed isn't in the room nor do I hear him in the connected bathroom. I hear sounds coming from downstairs and my intuition tells me that's where he is. I climb out of bed and immediately sense something. Actually, it's me having trouble sensing something and that's through my eyes. I can see objects further away from me, like the metallic handles of the shower, but when I look at the nightstand right next to me, it comes in as a blur. I put my hand in front of my face and though I can easily count the fingers on my hand, I can't make out details like my fingerprint or the shape of the lines on my palm. I figure Mr. Reed, as my Acting Benefactor, should know about this and know how to deal with this issue of mine.

I
13533322111213322.title: Finding Mr. Reed Through A Fog

choices: Left, to the garage
Straight into the living room
Right, to the family room and kitchen
13533323.content:
I decide to head straight for the first floor. I remember as a kid, in the middle of the night, I would sneak downstairs to raid the refrigerator or the pantry for snacks. I would do it without turning on any lights and my way of navigating through the dark would be to lightly run my hand against the wall. It would make a little bit of noise, but not enough to wake anyone up. I do the same as I make my way down the steps. I run my small female hand on the wall and keep it there as I descend down each step as slowly and as quietly as possible. Halfway down the first set of stairs, the wall abruptly turns to make a corner. Using only memory, my hand drops to the railing, which I remember I would only lightly touch, knowing that any more weight would cause the metal at the bottom to wobble, which in turn would cause creaking to sound in the wood it was inserted in.

I manage to get to the largest step in the middle of the two sets of stairs and get a view of the living room. Nothing has changed. Even the decorative piece made of tiny seashells and string hanging next to the china cabinet is still there. I remember my older brother and I tangling it to the point where we would get in trouble and he would blame me for it. Fortunately, I was my mother's favorite.

I reach the bother of the steps, feeling the cold hardwood flooring underneath the soles of my feet. I remember sliding along this floor with my socks and countless times, I would nearly be injured by doing said act. Now at the bottom, I can either take a left down a short hallway that would take me to the garage, continue straight and explore more of the living room that I had seen from the second floor, or head to my right, past the dining room, to the area consisting of the family room and kitchen.

To where shall I go next?
13533323.title: First Floor

choices: My father
My older brother
My uncle, my father's brother
135333232.content:
I walk straight into the living room, seeing the new layout of the old furniture. Someone had the idea to change the enclosed layout to an open layout. Instead of the couches facing each other and surrounding the coffee table, they are now placed against the walls with the coffee table in the same place, just with two of its sides open to the rest of the room. Everything is the same besides the furniture. What hasn't changed is the area next to the front door. Back when my older brother and I were kids, this place had an altar. We were Catholics back then and would go to church every Sunday. When we got older, we thought church was just another thing to do on a Sunday, so only our mother, who constantly tried to convert us, attended mass every Sunday. That is, until my mother grew sick. Doctors diagnosed it as cancer and after a year of fighting it, she succumbed to her illness. Her funeral was the last time we were in a church setting.

Now, instead of an altar with a man-made image of the Messiah peering down from its picture frame with stoic eyes, a memorial for our mother sat on a glass table that threatened to collapse due to how much weight was on it. A collection of snow globe, heavy trinkets, two vases with dying flower and not to forget, the large picture frame with a happy photo of my mother sat on the glass surface. I observed her face and realized that I was staring into a reflection, but it wasn't a mirror. Despite some different facial features, the face that my mother had had an uncanny resemblance to the face I saw in the mirror upstairs. Even the aging as well, since the picture that stood on the memorial table was one that was taken in my mother's younger years. I stood there frozen in place. When and how I changed from a man into a woman, either all the genes and traits and characteristics in the DNA somehow created this similar facade, as if this is the face and body I would have if I wasn't born a male, or someone had a hand in creating an almost-identical replica of my mother's face and body and somehow put my soul in it.

Again, I'm not in a panic nor am I bothered by it. The smile on my mother's young face tells me not to worry. It's the male persona that living inside my head that's freaking out.

"You're awake?" a male voice says from upstairs. I look up at the banister that overlooks the living room and see a man standing behind it. As my eyes rise, I see the face of my...?
135333232.title: Some Things Are the Same

choices: My older brother
A familiar man with a woman I do not recognize
A man in a business suit
1353332321.content:
I look up at the banister and see a pair of legs, covered by gray sweats. As my eye rise to see more of the person, the sweats disappear as a dark blue bath robe is wrapped around the top of the garment. I can only see muscular arms which tie the bath robe's drawstring to secure it to the body they belong to. My eyes widen as they pass the shoulders and collar of the man. It's none other than my father. He has a smile on his face, as if he is glad to see me. Question is: is he glad to see me as me or as this rather attractive woman who is a spitting image of his late wife?

I watch him walk down the hallway, away from my room, and I hear his heavy footsteps as he makes his way down the stairs. When he appears before me, I'm still looking up at him. If I was a man, I would be looking at him straight in the eye, for we were the same height. Now, I'm at least a foot shorter.

His smile seems to get brighter, but dims as he notices my apparent expression. Unknowingly, I drop my gaze, which causes him to lift it up gently with his hand so that our eyes meet. “What's wrong?” he asks with concern.

I look away from him and divert my eyes to the picture of mother. I gently pull my head away from his hand. For some reason, something begins to pull at me from within and it puts my whole body at unease. I struggle to tell my father, “I want to it's nothing, but it's unfair not knowing everything. I wake up like this, in this house and I see my mother in the mirror. What has happened?”

He comes up from behind and places firm hands on my shoulders. He is blunt in his response. “A lot has happened, but I want to let you know that most of it came from your choice.”

“I'm a woman because it was my choice?” I reiterate, the lump in my stomach causing the words to come out differently, as if they were delivered with contempt.

“I didn't mean it like that,” my father says, pressing his fingertips into the flesh of my shoulders. “If you're willing, there's someone coming that can explain everything to you.”

“Fine,” I say sarcastically. “Who is coming anyway?”

“They're right outside the door, actually,” my father says after looking at the screen of his phone. He goes to the front door, unlocks it and opens it, revealing the people behind it. Who is behind the door?
1353332321.title: Father

choices: Finish the presentation
13533323212.content:
When my father opens the door, there standing behind it is a man whose face I vaguely recognize and standing beside him is a woman who I don't recognize. Judging from their appearance, the woman is probably around my age while the man is around my father's age. Is this man the father of this young woman?

“Stephen! You're early!” my father says as a greeting. “Come in, come in!” As the two walk in, I stand aside and actually hide behind my father as he closes the door behind our visitors. I notice that the woman does the same thing. Is she in the same predicament? As I continue to observe her from afar, I see an uncanny resemblance to someone I met before. I can't recall who at the moment.

The man, who has the complexion of an African-American man, spots me hiding behind my father and asks a question. “Is this your...?” he begins, which my father kindly finishes.

“Yes, she's my charge,” my father affirms with a term that I'm not familiar with. What is a charge?

“Great,” the man, whose name is Stephen, says. “I guess we'll be able to go through the presentation. I just need your television.”

“It's all ready for you, over here,” my father says, pointing towards the built-in hole in the wall that frames the family room behind it. He leads and I follow, followed by the man and the younger woman. The family room somewhat has the same layout as the living room, save for the large entertainment system occupying the wall that the fireplace is also a part of it. Since we hardly ever use it, we just place the necessary furniture before it and the television above the mantle. I remember when we would host parties whenever there was a big basketball game or when our favorite boxer would fight on a pay-per-view match. The three couches in the room were able to seat many of our friends and family.

My father sits on the love seat that sits directly opposite the television and I sit next to him. Unconsciously, I swing one of my legs over and rest it on my other leg. This is probably due to my nightie being a bit too short. If I knew we were going to have visitors, I would have put something on to cover myself better. Though, when I recall the state of my room when I woke up, there was nothing available for me to put on.

Stephen and the young woman take a seat on the larger couch to our left. The black man sits closer to the side closest to the love seat we are sitting on while the younger woman sits towards the far end. Her eyes look all around the room and I realize that she's avoiding my eyes. Something is fishy about this woman and how come she looks like someone I met in my past?

“Alright, Thomas, how far along is your charge?” Stephen asks, which causes a red flag to rise in my mind. Is he ask what I think he's asking? Am I pregnant?

“I'd say, two days. She only got back on Saturday and has been asleep for most of the time. She actually just woke up a few minutes ago,” my father tells him. For some reason, something in my head deduces that it's not pregnancy that the black man is talking about, but about something else. “How far along is yours?”

Stephen turns to the young woman seated beside him and places a firm hand on her exposed leg. Her outfit consists of a pair of short khaki shorts and a pink hoodie that forms to her slender build. I notice a bit of annoyance on her face when he touches her. “I got her back Thursday. Like you, she was asleep for two days and woke up on Saturday. I personally gave her the presentation and I believe she understands,” the black man says. He removes his hand and gets to his feet. He goes to the messenger bag that he had set on the table. I must have not noticed him bringing it in since I was too focused on the woman who came with him. Out of the bag, he produces a DVD case, which he takes a disc from inside. He activates our Blu-Ray/DVD player and pops the disc in. He also turns on the speakers and raises the volume. It's weird how he knows how to operate the technology as if he has been in this house before. I forget that this man and my father seem to be friends.

The black man returns to his seat and stays quiet as the video appears. For some reason, my attention is drawn to it, as if it is speaking to me. For another reason, this time unusual even, I'm able to recall everything it presents. As each minute passes, I'm neither offended or motivated to protest against its message. I accept everything, which is very unusual for anyone to do.

The video presentation starts with a history lesson. As mind-boggling as it is, I believe everything that has transpired has really and truly happened without question. The video recalls a debilitating disease that affected about 35% of the total women last year, which 30% of the total succumbing to that disease. Most of the those affected were in fully-developed nations, with the United States, Japan, and the greater continent of Europe being the top-three. There was no known cure and by June of this year, about 90% of the women affect died.

The video goes on to a recent act or clause that was enacted concerning the well-being and economy of all the nations. For some odd reason, the people (which refers to the upper class, upper-middle class and elites of these nations), believe that the homeless, the criminals in our prisons and every apathetic young adults living in our communities are not contributing their share to the well-being of their resident nations. They say homeless people are living carefree, only living on handouts, never giving anything in return. They only make beautiful places their trash bin. Criminals get three square meals a day and are housed with beds and a roof over their head, all for free and we the taxpayers are paying for them. Young adults nowadays are so unmotivated that they live off their parents, the ones who have toiled and broke their backs for them. It was time for a change.

The change came with an Apathy Clause, which is actually geared more for young adults between the ages of 18 and 24. In addition, it only pertains to males, who are viewed as the head of households. Women, on the other hand, if in a relationship with a man or under responsibility of her father, is able to go about as she please and is not put under the Clause. Men who have graduated high school are therefore given a deadline at their 25th birthday. They are free to employ themselves in a job or career and are also encourage to go to college in hopes to get a job after graduation. Those in school are given deadlines after four years, six and even eight years for those in the medical field. For those in school, if they cannot keep a 2.0 GPA during their semesters, they are immediately withdrawn from school and put under the Apathy Clause. If they do graduate, but are not able to get employed six months after graduation, they too are put under the Apathy Clause. Same goes for those who have been employed before their 25th birthday. If they are somehow fired or their job terminates and cannot re-employ themselves after six months, they too are put under the Apathy Clause. This has all be enacted in efforts to de-saturate the competition in the job market. Hope goes to those who can achieve their dreams. To those cannot, must take a different route.

Under the Apathy Clause, the different route comes with gender modification. In an effort to battle the incurable disease that only affects women, the top governments have started to modify the genders of men who are under the Apathy Clause. Since these new women were initially men, they are immune to the disease. All throughout, the gender change is emphasized as a choice. If you choose to go through with it, your gender is changed and your are put in the responsibility to the closest male family member or legal guardian who can afford to put you under his roof. If there is none, then one is appointed to take responsibility for you. Unfortunately, if there is no family, friend, guardian or even a government-appointed guardian to take responsibility for you, then you are sent to an unclaimed pool, which includes those who refused or chose against the Clause's requirements. Instead of a gentle transformation, those who refused or chose against were forced to change regardless. The pool are then used for ill reasons that the presentation does not disclose.

The presentation goes on to describe what has happened, which it reiterates is all of our choosing. There is two routes where we can be changed. We can either have our minds, or as the presentations puts it, souls, from our male bodies into female bodies custom-made by our guardians, or have ourselves subjected to a chemical change, where hormones and other substances are used to literally change our genders at the microscopic level. The latter process takes more time, which also is more painful, but the end product is a body that feels much more in terms of sensations. One can say that senses in the body of the latter process are heightened a bit.
13533323212.title: Apathy Clause Pt. 1

choices: She was the son of Stephen's sister, Gwen
She was Tyrone, Stephen's son, the infamous roommate
She was the son of a young teacher I had in high school
135333232121.content:
The next part is life after the change. Stephen activates the portion for those who have had their souls transferred from one body to another and a video pertaining to the life after the change for mind transferrees begins. The video tells me that when we are changed, it is instantaneous and after a day, we are delivered to the place of our residence. We would be asleep for one to three days, with two being the average. When we wake up, it would feel like we do not remember anything save for a bit. This is usual for those who have had their minds transferred. Memories would start to gradually emerge as each day passes, totaling a maximum of five days, which makes the process last a week. If Stephen says that his charge, this woman who is under his responsibility, is on her fourth day, then she must remember more than what I remember.

The video finishes with a reassuring message to not panic, but to take this part of our lives as a learning experience. The video ends, which tells Stephen to ask a question to me directly. “So, Miss, did you understand everything?”

I want to protest and say that I didn't, but something inside me doesn't want to lie. “Yes,” I say, nodding my head. “I understood everything.” It's an understatement of what I actually understood, for the whole video actually replays in my mind several times over.

Stephen goes to his bag and pulls out a file with a stack of paperwork inside it. “Thomas, this is for you and her to go over, but inside you'll find a new identity for your charge. There is also the old identity there and information of what will happen to it from this point on,” Stephen says, handing the file over to my father. “I'd like to stay and all, but I have another appointment to attend to. If at all possible, can my charge stay her just until I get back?”

“Sure, anybody from the Brown household is welcome in mine,” my father says, which causes a flag to raise in my mind. Brown. Stephen Brown. From where have I heard that name? And again, why does this young woman at his side look so familiar?
135333232121.title: Apathy Clause Pt. 2

choices: Open some boxes
Go through the folder that Stephen gave us
Before I can decide, the doorbell rings
1353332321212.content:
Thomas, my father, stands and reaches a hand out to Stephen, who also stands and reaches out his own hand. They give each other a modest shake, to which my father gives his appreciation. "I appreciate you coming by and walking us through this, Stephen," Thomas says.

"Oh, anything to help out a friend and his charge. It's a big decision you two are making, but I hope for the best," Stephen says, directing his phrase both to my father and I. He gives me a slight nod which I return with one of my own.

"Let me get the door for you," Thomas says and he leads Stephen out of the family room and into the living room. I get to my feet to follow, which the charge of Stephen also does. Thomas opens the door and gives out a surprised gasp. "Hey, what's this box doing out here?"

"That belongs to you and your charge, but most especially your charge. This is the care package that's provided. Every 1-2 weeks, a package is delivered containing an assortment of clothes to fill up your charge's wardrobe as well as books that will help in becoming more of what she'll potentially be. For the first few months, you will just be getting an introductory package, but you will soon be able to handpick what goes in the package. Also, your charge is given a card that she can use for purchases as well," Stephen explains before helping Thomas bring the packages into the house. Judging from their struggle, it looks like the boxes, which total to two large boxes and one small box, are quite heavy.

"Thanks again, Stephen," Thomas says allowing the black man to exit through the open door.

"I'll probably be back around dinnertime. We probably can go out for a meal with everyone. Will I see your eldest?" Stephen says, possibly referring to my older brother.

"I'm not sure," Thomas replies, "he didn't specify when he was going to be back. It was either tonight or tomorrow."

"Well, I'll see him when I see him," Stephen says and bids farewell to us.

Thomas closes the door and turns to find me looking at the boxes. Actually, I'm looking at the smallest of the three and wondering what could be inside. "Baby," my father addresses me as such while pulling me gently by my arms, "before we see what's in these boxes, don't you want to go through that folder that Stephen gave us first?"

I look over at the family room where we had left the folder, but I also catch a glimpse of the woman that Stephen left behind for my father to... "babysit."

"Who is she?" I whisper to my father.

"She's one of Stephen's charges. Don't concern yourself with her, she's just going to stay here until her uncle comes back," my father tells me.

"So potentially, she's Stephen's nephew-turned-niece," I whisper, though this time more louder.

"Not necessarily--" my father says, but I cut him off as I pull away from him and approach the girl. She looks tense as I close the distance between her and I.

I look up to her face. She visibly gulps a bit of her saliva, telling me she is nervous, but about what? I calmly ask, "Can I talk to you for a little bit?"

"Okay," the young woman says and I take her to the kitchen so I can talk more privately with her. Once I'm more out of my father's way, I start to ask her questions. "You know, you look familiar to me. Do I personally know you?"

The young woman with mocha skin answers, "I don't think so. I'm a new charge, just like you, so I don't think you would recognize me that quickly."

"I don't know," I start. "You look like someone's mother, though a bit younger. I think her name was Gwen." The young woman before me fidgets ever so slightly. Gwen must have been a name she recognizes. "She was nice and protective of her son, who kept getting into trouble. Her son's name was Tyrone." The woman's breathing looks to be quickening. Am I getting hotter or colder? It looks more like the former. "I can't explain it, but I can certainly say this while sounding crazy, since I don't care if I sound crazy or not. But it's this certain Tyrone who put me in this situation. He had a glove which could change things. He slapped me with the glove, changing me into a woman. But not only that, he put me back in the house I lived in as a kid, but now I'm this woman living here."

I'm surprised at how successful being a tad bit crazy can do to people around you. The young woman seems to respond to every word I say, convicting her of guilt that apparently seems to be true. At the climax of it all, she speaks up, admitting to her fault. "Okay, okay, Cesar, I'm sorry. I knew what your mother looked like and when I saw a younger version of her, I could only think that you would be in her body while I was somehow transported and put into a younger version of my mother's body," she blurts out, on the verge of tears even. "I'm guilty, okay. Guilty because of that glove. If I didn't do what I did, we wouldn't be in this place, in these bodies."

Without knowing it, my father appears near the kitchen and sees Tyrone in his female body in tears. "What's going on you two?" he asks, coming closer to us.

"I was just asking her a question," I say in my defense.

"Are you two arguing? Because, Tyra here is a guest and we don't make guests in our home cry--" he tries to scold me, but Tyra, Tyrone's new name, defends me.

"It's nothing, Tommy. We weren't arguing. I was just glad. We actually knew each other before we were... you know. She was just comforting me, that's all," Tyra says. I'm surprised to hear her say that even after all the instigating I've been doing. I actually feel like I'm the one at fault. "I've been tired lately, that's all."

"Well, we should let you rest. You know where the guest room is. Why don't you lie down for a bit," my father says to her, almost in a caring, loving way. I wonder, has Tyra been here in the past few days with my father... alone? I can't really ask that question, since I seem to have a sensitivity to it. And I don't want to cause Tyra to cry any more than she has. Tyra leaves, wiping her tears with the sleeves of her sweater, leaving my father and I alone. He turns to face me and gives me a look which I cannot read.

"What?" I ask.

"Nothing," he simply says, but I know it's a lie. "We have time to kill. We can either go through the folder that Stephen left for us or start opening the boxes."

What do I decide to do?
1353332321212.title: Tyrone, the Infamous Roommate

choices: Family Room
My Bedroom
His Bedroom
1353332322.content:
I look the man from bottom to top, starting with naked hairy legs. When my eyes rise towards his knees, they are covered by a white fabric. As my eyes rise even more, I discover it to be a white towel, neatly tucked in on itself around the man's waist. But I spy a rather handsome waist, connected to a bare torso that's lean and somewhat muscular. Not too ripped like the body of a body builder, but I can tell this person has worked out to some degree to eliminate any evidence of a beer belly. The torso is connected to a neck which of course has a head attached to it. The face is much a surprise to me. It's none other than the face of my older brother, Edwin. He smiles from cheek to cheek as our eyes meet. "Wait, right there, okay," he says to me and runs towards where his room would've have been if we didn't switch it like countless times in the past. I then hear the creak of the steps as he quickly makes his way down the stairs. He appears halfway down the steps now dressed in a black bathrobe and in his hand he holds a similar fabric that's colored in such a way that I assume it has a flower design on it. I'm assuming he got this for me.

When he gets to the first floor, he holds it out, confirming my assumptions. It is a bath robe, made for a smaller person. Not wanting to refuse his kindness, and also wanting to cover up my awkwardness wearing this babydoll, I slip my arms into the sleeves and allow my big brother to drape the rest of the light fabric over my bare shoulders. Once the majority of the garment in on my body, I take each side of the robe and wrap it tightly over the rest of my torso, using the provided rope to cinch the garment tight around my waist. I also use my arm to push the hair that has been caught under the collar of the robe out and over the back of it.

"Good fit," my brother says, to which I turn around. I look at his face again. I observe how much he hasn't changed and then compare to myself which is the complete opposite. I hang my head low because of how much I have changed. I'm no longer his younger brother. Heck, I don't think I can consider myself his sister. I don't think it works that way. He lifts my head with his hand, lightly grasping my chin with two finger and lifting my jaw upward so that my eyes meet his again. "What's wrong?" I somehow get emotional and I'm on the verge on tears when he continues. "Right, right." He steps away from me. "This must be very awkward for you. But I can explain things. It's my job to anyways. Whoever changed you into the person you are now, they have given me material that you need to watch and read. If you're ready, we can go over those materials."

I finally speak with my new voice, which is higher-pitched than my brother's deep, manly voice. I ask, "Materials about what? Are you saying that this was no accident?" I try not to sound pessimistic as if whatever I'm thinking about has done this to take advantage of my new form.

"There's this new law, which the government passed six months ago, that say certain people have to change in order to..." he trails off, unsure of what words to say. After a brief pause, he continues. "It's hard to explain. That's why they gave me material that can explain it fully."

"They'll explain everything?' I ask, still perturbed at how feminine my voice sounds like.

"I hope so," he says and closes the distance between us. He reaches his two arms and places his hands on my arms. He squeezes them gently as he says, "I don't want you to worry about anything at all. So shall we start? There is a video and some paperwork, so it's best to watch it on a TV screen. Just where should we watch it?"

Where in the house do we watch these materials?
1353332322.title: Big Brother

choices: Continue to video
13533323223.content:
"I don't really care, really," I say to him as I lift my head to meet his face. "If you don't mind, we can watch it in your room."

"Really? You're cool about that?" he asks, surprised that I would even bring up the thought.

"We can watch it in the family room if you don't want to," I mention.

"That won't be necessary," he says, "in fact, the materials, the video disc and the paperwork, they are all upstairs. I guess it's convenient that you mentioned my room, actually."

"Save us the legwork," I add.

"Right. Well, shall we? Ladies, first," he says. I ignore the fact that I am now a lady and gladly take the lead, watching around my brother and back up the stairs. When I get to the top, I hang a left past two door that are opposite one another and through the door at the end of the small hallway. Once inside my brother's room, I halt myself taking in the nostalgia of the placement of items in the room. It's as I remember it from years past. Actually, if I remember correctly, my brother had left the room like this when he left for university.
