Even the mess is reminiscent of that time.

My brother quickly places his hands on my shoulders and gently pushes me to the door. He apologizes as he rushes into the room before me. "Sorry about the mess, I had just got back last night," he says. Coincidentally, I see scatter on his desk several item that I haven't seen before. One of which is eye-catching and draws my attention at once. It's a certificate that is handsomely framed. And it has my brother's name on it. Edwin Lopez. Under his name, I spy the words "congratulate" and "awards" and "completing." I can only assume one thing.

"You did it," I softly say.

"What?" he answers in a clueless fashion. I pick up the framed diploma and present to him. "Right," he softly says and takes on a warm smile as he looks it over. He breathes out a sigh, but I'm unsure if it's one out of relief or disappointment. Out of concern, I try not to investigate further.

My curiosity though wonders if there was a ceremony and visual evidence that there was one. "Did you take any pictures?" I ask.

Edwin walks around me and puts the framed diploma back on the table. Again he lets out a sigh, but this time, I can tell that he didn't do it out of relief. I want to ask, but the gentleness of my new character doesn't want to pry. "I didn't walk," he says, walking over to the door and closing it shut.

"What do you mean?" I ask.

"I mean what I mean," he says, but stumbles on his next phrase. "Not that I didn't graduate, which I did. It's just... I didn't walk."

"How come?" I ask.

My brother takes a moment before speaking. Knowing the question has already been asked, I dare not repeat it and annoy him. That much I know. From the door, he turns around and faces me. "There was a ceremony, but I didn't choose to partake in it. To respect my wishes, they gave me the diploma in advance," he explains, but my curiosity isn't sated.

"Why didn't you?" I ask one more question and for some reason, I could feel the mood in the room change slightly.

Almost immediately, and probably out of annoyance, Edwin answers, "Because of you." His direct, almost aggressive answer, forces me into silence. At the same time, the answer seems to be accompanied with an unseen, physical force that pushes me back until I'm stopped by the foot board of my brother's bed. Awkwardly, the top of the foot board supports the protrusion of my butt, allowing me to lightly sit on it. Edwin approach me, slowly, as to not come off as a mad brother. During his slow pacing towards me, he takes several deep breaths. "It's the damn Apathy Clause. Brutal to anyone who ignores it. Brutal especially to me." Edwin changes his course and walk around the bed to sit on the edge of the mattress. "The law was passed a week before the end of my program. Dad was the one who called me about it, saying that you were a drop out and that you would be one of the men affected by the Clause. He told me he had already done it for his wife's brother and that I would be the one to help my own. When class was over, I traveled back and went with you to the place where we would do the paperwork. You weren't reluctant at all and actually was looking for to it. Once we were done, you at once did the procedure, but the technicians told me due to the certain things we selected, your completion wouldn't finish until after six months. At the time, I didn't know when graduation would happen, so I assumed it would be a month after your change was finished. I was bummed to hear that they would hold it three weeks after the end of class and that I couldn't postpone it. Because of you, I told them that I wasn't going to walk the ceremony. I didn't walk, because I wanted you to be there."

I couldn't understand half of the things he was telling me and some thing he left very vague, but it seems that we had caught up with each other during that week when he came back to take me to that appointment. I feel he was concerned for me and for some reason, his words touch upon my heart. I dismount the foot board and walk to where he is seated. I put a firm hand on his shoulder and honestly say, "I didn't understand much of what you were saying, but I somehow feel good that you wanted me to see you walk at the graduation ceremony. I don't know why, but I want to say thank you."

"Well, maybe if we watch this video, you'll find out why," he says, getting up from the bed and rounding the bed frame as well as myself, he goes over to the table to fetch a folder, from which he takes out a disc. He inserts it into a player and turns the wall-mounted TV on. He guides me to the couch sitting against the wall and takes a seat right next to me. At once, the video starts.
13533323223.title: His Bedroom

choices: Making breakfast for me
Presenting me with gifts
Drawing a bath for me
135333232231.content:
The video starts with a history lesson, which recalls a debilitating disease that affected about 35% of the total women last year, which 30% of the total succumbing to that disease. Most of the those affected were in fully-developed nations, with the United States, Japan, and the greater continent of Europe being the top-three. There was no known cure and by June of this year, about 90% of the women affected died. As mind-boggling as it my seem, I somehow believe the history that the video present is true. If not, why would there be a law like this.

The video goes on to a recent act or clause that was enacted concerning the well-being and economy of all the nations. For some odd reason, the people (which refers to the upper class, upper-middle class and elites of these nations), believe that the homeless, the criminals in our prisons and all of the apathetic young adults living in our communities are not contributing their share to the well-being of their resident nations. They say homeless people are living carefree, only living on handouts, never giving anything in return. They only make beautiful places their trash bin. Criminals get three square meals a day and are housed with beds and a roof over their heads, all for free and we, the taxpayers, are paying for them. Young adults nowadays are so unmotivated that they live off their parents, the ones who have toiled and broke their backs for them. They ruin their own futures and therefore ruins the future of the younger generations. It was finally time for a change.

The change came with an Apathy Clause, which is actually geared more for young adults between the ages of 18 and 24. In addition, it only pertains to males, who are viewed as the head of households. Women, on the other hand, if in a relationship with a man or is independent with a decent job to maintain modest living for herself and anybody in her household or is under responsibility of her father, is able to go about as she please and is not put under the Clause. Men who have graduated high school are therefore given a deadline at their 25th birthday. They are free to employ themselves in a job or career and are also encourage to go to college in hopes to get a job after graduation. Those in school are given deadlines after four years, six and even eight years for those in the medical field. For those in school, if they cannot keep a 2.0 GPA during their semesters, they are immediately withdrawn from school and put under the Apathy Clause. If they do graduate, but are not able to get employed six months after graduation, they too are put under the Apathy Clause. Same goes for those who have been employed before their 25th birthday. If they are somehow fired or their job terminates and cannot re-employ themselves after six months, they too are put under the Apathy Clause. This has all be enacted in efforts to de-saturate the competition in the job market. Hope goes to those who can achieve their dreams. To those cannot, must take a different route.

Under the Apathy Clause, the different route comes with gender modification. In an effort to battle the incurable disease that only affects women, the top governments have started to modify the genders of men who are under the Apathy Clause. Since these new women were initially men, they are immune to the disease. All throughout, the gender change is emphasized as a choice. If you choose to go through with it, your gender is changed and your are put in the responsibility to the closest male family member or legal guardian who can afford to put you under his roof. If there is none, then one is appointed to take responsibility for you. Unfortunately, if there is no family, friend, guardian or even a government-appointed guardian to take responsibility for you, then you are sent to an unclaimed pool, which includes those who refused or chose against the Clause's requirements. Instead of a gentle transformation, those who refused or chose against were forced to change regardless. The pool are then used for ill reasons that the presentation does not disclose.

The presentation goes on to describe what has happened, which it reiterates is all of our choosing. There is two routes where we can be changed. We can either have our minds, or as the presentations puts it, souls, from our male bodies into female bodies custom-made by our guardians, or have ourselves subjected to a chemical change, where hormones and other substances are used to literally change our genders at the microscopic level. The latter process takes more time, which also is more painful, but the end product is a body that feels much more in terms of sensations. One can say that senses in the body of the latter process are heightened a bit.

I ask Edwin to pause the video here and when it is paused, I ask, "So what route did we agree on?"

"I actually didn't agree to it, but you were adamant about it. Since it was your choice to go through with it, I gave in. Heck, you even signed for it," he explains and gets up momentarily to retrieve a paper from the folder. The paper he takes out is a form that is akin to a joint bank account, but in this case, I am the client and he is a co-signer or witness. At the bottom of the page is the signature I've been using for the past six years. "Here it says, I, Cesar Lopez, agree to have my body administered with the needed chemicals to change my body at the microscopic level. By signing below, I have understood and hold myself responsible of understanding that this modification route may potentially be painful and life-threatening."

"Okay, I understand," I say and tell Edwin to play the video.

The next part of the video is life after the change, which informs that when we are changed, the drastic modification of the physical may affect the memory of the individual going through the change. Since clients are given anesthesia that last for four to six months, most will wake up a month or more after the procedure is done. As the client is still under the effects of the drug, they are carefully delivered to the place of their residence. A technician will monitor the client, making sure vitals stay within desired range. In some cases, client are given a chemical that counter-acts the effect of the anesthesia, though clients will not wake fully until two to three days after administering the counter-acting drug, with two being the average. When the client finally wakes up, it would feel like she does not remember anything save for a bit. This is usual since the anesthesia more or less disconnects the mind and memory, which may remember the body being male, from the body, which is drastically changed. Memories would start to gradually emerge as each day passes, totaling a maximum of five days, which makes the process last a week, though in some cases, memories start to flare up in just a day.

The video, for the first time, addresses the witness or guardian. It congratulates him and the client and tells them that this is just the beginning. We are to consider ourselves fortunate that the Apathy Clause found favor in us. To the guardian, the video tells him to care for the client, since lift will be different from this point on. It's his assistance that will help the client in the long run.

The video finishes with a reassuring message to not panic, but to take this part of our lives as a learning experience. The video then ends.

Edwin takes the disc out and puts it back in its sleeve. He turns around and asks, "So, did you understand everything?"

"Pretty much," I simply state. "I just have to wait for my memories to come back."

"So when you woke up, did you remember anything at all?" he asks.

"No," I say, "I actually didn't know about all those women dying."

"Really? It was all over the news. What I don't get is how they didn't give anyone any notice of the passing of the Apathy Clause. It just showed up out of the blue," he explains.

I look up at him from the couch. "So what's next?" I ask him.

"Well, the video said it is just the beginning. All I have to do is take care of you," he tells me.

How does he do this as a start?
135333232231.title: Apathy Clause Video

choices: He simply cuffs my hands behind my back
He cuffs me to the frame of the bed
He cuffs my hands to a ring high up on a wall
1353332323.content:
Quickly, I look up, because I recognize the voice that has spoken. It's the voice of my Uncle Niko. My body freezes mostly because I know firsthand how strict and demanding the man is. As a senior in high school, while I wanted to work right after graduation, he adamantly insisted I go to community college and use financial aid to pay my way through school. Ever since that time, for three years, he would contact me every month to see how I was doing. Mostly, he was only concerned with how my studies were progressing. I grew tired of his constant calls after that and when given the phone, I would avoid them outright. Soon after, I would move out to move in with the roommates that got me in this mess in the first place.

I can only look up past his white tank top and gray sweats pants and meet his gaze. I gulp a wad of saliva as he peers from the second floor banister, like a predatory brid setting his sights on his prey. I stay still as he moves from his position on the banister to the stairs and from the stairs to where I'm standing. As he approaches and gets close to me, I can already see the apparent different between us. My uncle Niko had been a military man, progressing through the ranks of the Air Force until becoming an officer. Then he gained the opportunity to fly large planes. As I was a man, he would still be taller than me by a couple inches. Only my older brother could contend against him just by height alone. Now that I'm a woman, he towers over me like a skyscraper would in comparison to a mere house. He gets within inches of me and out of fear and anxiousness, I dare not look up at him. I can literally feel his eyes on my attractive body.

He steps to his right and proceeds to walk around me. As he does, he takes one of his fingers to trace along both my shoulder and my upper back. This tickles me but it also helps me to relax. I feel him position himself as if he is facing in the same direction as me. He places his warm hands on my cold skin of my upper arms and leans in to whisper into my ear. "For a second there, I could have sworn we agreed we wouldn't make you an average mind-transfer woman with the body of a submissive girl," he says into my ear. I observe he mentioned that "we agreed," noting that him and someone else agreed to what I was to become. Was it my father that he agreed with or is it the forbidden thought? Was it him and I who agreed to it? I want to believe that the last thing I would do is agree with my Uncle Niko about the current body and image I am in. "Then again, I know that my nephew is in this head and body." He traces his finger down my arm as he says this. "They had used microscopic nanobots to change you from the inside out, at the microscopic level, using your old male body to create this new female body. Plus, going that route served to almost heighten every nerve by a certain percentage. Not much, but it would manifest later than sooner."

I finally find an opportunity to speak. "What are you talking about?" I say in my new feminine voice, sultry and high-pitched.

He answers as he rounds me to my front, this time with a louder voice, "Seems like the anesthesia that they administered you was stronger than it initially seemed. It kept you asleep as they pumped you full of nanobots. It seems that you were still asleep even after the procedure was done. That explains why they brought you here in that inanimate state. Heck, you were still asleep for two days straight." He then turns so that he is now facing me. He again draws close so that he is only an inch or two away from me. His hand gently grasps my jaw and with it he pushes my chin up, forcing me to look at his face. I can only deduce the expression on his face is over dominance, that I'm just a weaker being before him. "You must be hungry." He lets go of my face. "Why don't you go back to your room and wait there. I will cook something up and then I will bring it up to you." As if I didn't hear him the first time, he uses his hand to gently push me forward. I walk past him and back up to the second floor, making my way to my room after getting to the top.

Once in my room, I take a seat on the bed. In the time it takes for my uncle to get back, I use that opportunity to make the bed, hoping that my uncle will see me in a new light, though not just in a physical sense. After about twenty minutes, he shows up with a tray with a large platter that holds a delicious breakfast, both appealing by the sight and smell of it. Also on the tray is a pitcher of orange juice. He sets the tray down on the table.

"Before I let you have your meal, I have one more thing for you," he tells me.

I ask, "What's that?"

"This," he briefly says and out of his pocket he reveals a metallic object. Two metal rings connected by a short chain. It was none other than a pair of handcuffs.

"What are those for?' I ask, a bit apprehensive of the potential uses for it. I back away from him, but in the small room, I can only get so far. The backs of my legs run into the bed and I accidentally force myself to sit.

"For this..." he simply says and trails off as he approaches me with the handcuffs.

What is my uncle's intentions for these handcuffs?
1353332323.title: Uncle Niko

choices: I stay quiet and don't tell him a thing
I be honest and tell him the truth
I continue to lie
13533323231.content:
I can't do much in this situation. I find that I'm much weaker than I was when I was a guy. Compared to the tall, muscular man before me, I'm a fragile twig. My reluctant self tries to resist, but knowing my uncle and his background as mostly military, I realize I cannot thwart any close-quarters techniques that he has in his arsenal. I try to push him away, but all that does is give him my hands to hold and the leverage to flip me from my butt to my stomach. Using just the right amount of weight to hold me down and pin me to the bed, but not too much that it applies pain to my body, he is able to gather my arms behind my back and take the handcuffs and secure each metallic ring on each of my wrists. Once the cuffs are fastened at just the right tightness, where they is little to no movement between the skin of my wrist and the inside of the cuffs, he removes his weight from me.

"Sorry about that, dear," he apologizes. "I need to show you something and this is the only way I can show you. Why don't you roll over and sit up." I try to ignore him in retaliation towards his handling of me, but the rumbling in my stomach and the weakness I feel from not having eaten force me up. I shift my weight in a sort of spiral, using my cuffed hands as leverage by pressing down on the mattress. I then kick my leg out in order to rotate my upper body upward, until I'm sitting up on the edge of the bed and my butt is planted on the mattress. Though, in my doing so, one of the straps to my babydoll slips off my shoulder. Already I can feel that side of my short nightgown start to slip off more from my body. Fortunately, my uncle sees the strap and immediately takes it and drapes it over my shoulder. I feel the need to thank him, but he starts speaking again. 'Alright, now, you just have to relax because I'm going to feed you your breakfast, okay?" I nod in understanding.

He first gets an empty glass and starts pouring orange juice from the pitcher into it. Once it's full, he lifts it from the table and over to my mouth. As the glass gets near, I open my mouth to receive it. The edge of the glass is gently rest on my lips and when my uncle tilts the glass ever so slowly, the orange liquid gets poured into my mouth. I immediately swallow as much as I can as not to choke on the juice. When I've down about three ounces of the liquid, my uncle tilts it back and takes it back to the table. He then takes a spoon and uses a fork to shovel and push the scrambled eggs into it. He carries the spoonful of food over to my mouth, hovering his hand underneath to catch anything that falls. When I'm presented with the food, I open my mouth wide to accept the spoon. The food slowly gets carried into my mouth and once I feel the warmth of the eggs and whatever it was mixed with, my jaws close down. My uncle pulls the spoon through my closed lips and easily it comes out devoid of any food. As he puts the spoon back, I am busy chewing my food until it is digested enough to swallow.

Once I've swallowed my first spoonful, my uncle sits next to me on the bed. He doesn't ask about the food, probably because the sound that I've made and the fact that I'm not hiding any of my food in my cheeks tells him enough that I've enjoyed it. He speaks to ask a question. "If you're still asking about the handcuffs and why I decided to feed is because of the current dilemma we find ourselves in. In a couple of days, the effects of the anesthesia from your procedure will wear off and your memories will gradually come back. But, just so you're not left in the dark, the dilemma we have is the Apathy Clause. Yes, you were made into the person you now are, mostly on mutual agreement. You may not understand that now, but in a couple of days you will. But I wanted to give you sense that you can make all the decisions you want, but your well-being is in my hands. I guess I'm just here to make sure you don't kill yourself or do something drastic. Now, that brings up a topic that I'm most interested about. It's regarding how much I can trust you. I corresponded with you the three years after you graduated high school, but the fourth year, my calls stopped coming. The reason for this is actually pertaining to the Apathy Clause. I knew you and your brother had the possibility of becoming involved, so I tried to reason with people to make you guys an exception. It turned out I couldn't. There was no bribing or coercing that I could do to make that happen. The Clause weighed heavily on the choices that you made that there was no possibility for outside forces to act upon it. And because of my protests, I was banned from calling you to prevent the Clause from catching up to you. Well, I want to ask a question for you. In the year that I didn't call you, what have you done?"

The last year which I didn't call or received calls from him is a touchy subject. I decide to lie in order to get off the hook. With my high-pitched, almost cute voice, I tell him, "Well, I continued to go to school until I had enough credits to transfer to university. Since the university I pick was far from home, I decided to move in--" but my uncle interrupts me quite abruptly.

I'm not expecting it to happen and indeed, it catches me off guard. In the pit of my stomach, I believe that my uncle knows pretty well what I had done in the past year. His interruption comes in the form of a slap, hard enough to cause my cheek to sting, but not forceful enough to send me flying in the direction he had slapped me. I'm about to sit in place without careening over to the floor, but damn, that slap stings. 'If you're going to lie to me, at least make sure whoever is lying to you doesn't know the truth already," he says. "Did you really think I didn't know what you were doing? So why don't you tell me truthfully exactly what you did in the past year."

I can do one of either three things. I can stay quiet and don't tell him of the past year. I can be honest and tell him the realest truth. Or I can continue to lie to him which in turn will garner me more slaps from my uncle. What should I do?
13533323231.title: Arrested

choices: Let him leave while I finish my breakfast
Take his hand and convince him to stay
Let him leave for the moment, but look for him at a later time
135333232312.content:
While my cheek is still stinging in pain, I take a few deep breathes to gather myself. I decide to tell the truth. "Okay, in the months that you didn't call, I still went to school. When I thought that you had forgotten about me, I started slacking off. Dad more or less became what you were, so six months after you didn't call, I couldn't take it anymore. I had left the house as well as school and ran with the wrong people. I moved into my friends house where two of his roommates lived as well. That place was a party house and none of us went to school. We were all dropouts,"

"Okay," my uncle says to stop me from talking. He pauses himself to stand. He goes over to me, grabs my upper arm and gently gets me to my feet. He guides me to the table, my back facing him. One part of me thinks he has done this so he can take advantage of me. It's relieved when he reaches for a metallic key sitting on the same platter as my breakfast. He takes it and proceeds to take off my handcuffs. He struggles to continue speaking. "I believe I can trust you since you told me the honest truth. I'll leave you unbound to finish your breakfast," he says, almost in a low tone at the end of his sentence.

Once the cuffs are off my wrists, my uncle takes them and exits the room without another word. It feels like I should do something. I can either let him leave while I finish my breakfast, let him leave for a moment and at a later time look for him, or immediately get him to stay.

What should I do?
135333232312.title: Honest Truth

choices: Extend his arm and lay my head on it while I cling to his side
Crawl over to him and lay my head on his chest
Scoot over to him and while I sit on my lower legs, place a hand on his chest
1353332323123.content:
Part of me, which is the old part of me, is glad that he is away from me after slapping me and getting me to spill the bean of the past years. The other part of me, which is the new part of me, and which also includes the emotions and sensations I feel as this new female me, is affect by him leaving the room and is eager to leave my breakfast and run out after him. Honestly, the female side of me seems to be overtaking the old, male side of me in a seemingly one-sided victory with my female side as the commander. My uncle did mention that my memory would come back, but I don't think it'll matter after what I've already decided to do.

Judging from his heavy footsteps, he had went down the hallway to the master bedroom, which is right next to the room I'm in. I look at my breakfast and I find myself with no appetite. Touched by the mood of the situation, I walk out of my room, take a right and down the rest of the hallway and into the master bedroom. Immediately, I find my uncle on the bed, staring at the ceiling and taking deep breaths. He notices me come in and looks towards my way. "Hey, is there something wrong?" he asks.

I twist my lower body sideways and side-straddle the edge of the bed. I look around at the master bedroom for a bit, taking in the similarities and the differences. Not much is different save for a couple of suitcases. The suitcases are very familiar as they are the same ones that my uncle had used when he visited the house years ago. Other than that, it's the same room that belongs to my father. When I think of it, I wonder he is. I then look at my uncle's concerned face and tell him, "Well, you sort of left very abruptly. I was confused. I'm not sure if I said something or did something wrong."

"No, no, it wasn't you. I'm the reason I left like that," he tells me, still laying down. A small part of me finds his side inviting, but I keep my impulses in check. "Your father had told me everything that had happened. Assuming you were still the nephew that I previously knew, I expected you either to stay quiet or talk your way out of the situation. When you kept yourself composed as you were telling me the truth of what happened during that fourth year, I was surprised as well as touched by how you handled that situation that I felt bad hitting you across the cheek that time. Are you okay?"

My hand rises to touch upon the cheek that was struck by my uncle's hand. When my fingertip lightly touches the skin, it starts to sting, causing me to hiss. "Yes," I simply say, after which I notice something. I observe a smile that seems to be a struggle for my uncle. I wonder, is there something that is burden for him. Not just this dilemma, with him having to take care of me with this new body. There's something else. "Are you okay?"

He had been staring at the ceiling when I asked him the question. He continues to stare at it as if deep in thought. He doesn't say anything, as if he is holding a deluge of acid that eating him up from the inside out. I can understand a bit. That acid may affect me if he lets it go and it might change the already-altered relationship we have between us.

I realize I need to do something in order for him to spill his beans. What should I do though?
1353332323123.title: Separate to Bring Back Together

choices: He pulls me onto his lap once more
He gets up so he can kiss me full on the lips
A wrenching headache causes me to collapse
13533323231233.content:
I scoot over to him until I'm right beside him. I'm still seated, in a position where my knees are bent and my lower legs and feet are in contact with my thighs and butt cheeks respectively. The direction I'm facing is towards the headboard, so that my legs are parallel to his side. I place a firm, yet gentle hand on my uncle's chest. I'm surprised it's still muscular and toned for his age. I rub it like I'm like the Karate Kid waxing a car. The friction between my hand and my uncle's shirt causes my hand to get hot. It also has secondary effects. One, it causes my uncle to raise the arm that I'm more of less pinning down with one of my legs and move it over towards me, wrapping it around the far side of my waist. I close my eyes as the hand wanders from the waist downwards, as if trying to find purchase on wherever his hand may securely hold. His hand moves from my waist, around the roundness of my butt until stopping to insert between my thigh and ankle. As his hand sits there, I can feel the warmth of it transferring to my legs. Its position is in an awkward place, but the warmth relaxes me. Two, he raises his other hand to stop the one that's rubbing against his chest. Unusually, it stops right where his heart is and through the shirt and through the skin, I can faintly feel it as it rise and falls. My uncle hand, which is much bigger than mine, caresses my wrist and forearm, relaxing me even further.

"In my time of turmoil, I cannot believe that God had sent an angel," he mutters. In a quick movement, he raises his torso, using his pelvis as the lever. At the same time, he gather me into his arms and while he positions himself at the end of the bed, he plants me side-straddle in his lap. This puts our face close to each other, close enough that I can feel his warm breath on my face. I cannot muster anything to say, but that's alright, for he slowly speaks to me. "Did you know you look like your mother?" I stare at him in such a way that tells him that I'm unsure. "She had the same blank stare as you have right now. Your aunt on the other hand, while she was like your mother in his younger years, once the Apathy Clause came around and I took it upon myself to take responsibility for you, she got angry and jealous. She thought that with you like this, you would sooner or later steal the attention that I had on your aunt. Without thinking, she filed a divorce and left me. That was three months ago, halfway through your procedure."

"I'm sorry to hear that," I tell him, placing my hand on the larger hand resting on my knee.

He looks deeply at me for what seems like forever and I'm captivated by his attention. He smiles warmly and I do the same. Then all of a sudden, he starts to chuckle and turn his head away. My smile disappears and a look of confusion takes its place. I wonder what has turned his mood around. He speaks, explaining the reason. "Sorry about that," he first apologizes for the change of emotion. "Here I am telling you that I am a divorced man who told his ex-wife that he wouldn't have affection towards his charge, not when she was around. Now that she's been out of the house for three months, all I've been doing is waiting for you to arrive."

"Wait," I say as a gentle interruption. "Then why are you here at my house? Did something happen to yours?"

"Nice observation," he says. "It's true. To settle the divorce, we both agreed to sell the house and split the funds down the middle. Your dad was willing enough to let me stay here. The both of us have the same responsibility, just not the same circumstances."

"Right, my mother died two years after my graduation," I mention. "That reminds me." I push off of my uncle's body and get to my feet. I stand straight in front of him while I clasp my hands together in front of me. "Now that you've heard from my own mouth the truth of the fourth year, I don't think I've apologized for it." I pause just to take a deep breath and inadvertently cause my breasts to rise and fall with the expanding of my chest. "I want to say I'm sorry for ruining my life and causing you to once again make it right again."

With my head bowed, I'm unsure how my uncle is taking this. I flinch a bit, as I'm surprised, when he reaches a hand towards me to place his warm palm on the very same cheek that he slapped. Some of the flinch was in fact a reaction to the stinging that seems to have subsided a bit, but not much. What is his full reaction?
13533323231233.title: Gentle Hand

choices: A woman who has features similar to my father
Two men who I recognize
My father with a woman
135333232312333.content:
My uncle opens his mouth to speak, but as he does so, there is a ringing in my head that seems to drown out all external sounds, including my uncle's voice. The intense ringing is followed by a pain that wells up from the base of my skull and heightens in throbbing around my brows, causing me to clutch at those areas. I can't help but groan with my high-pitched voice. The pain is too much that my legs turn to jelly and I collapse to the floor.

If it weren't for my uncle, who catches me, I would have more than a splitting headache. He manages to guide me to the floor with my head resting on his knee. I look up at my uncle, but all I can see is a distorted image. Everywhere I look, my vision is blurry. Not long after, I black out.

I float in a sea of black, but only for a brief moment. What comes after is a deluge of memories. Unusually enough, even though they flash before my eyes like a video tape on fast forward, I retain my knowledge of everything. From the appointment with my uncle and a representative assigned to our case regarding the Apathy Clause, which felt like I was signing up for college, though with a somewhat more reassuring uncle, to the month spent reading up all I could about the life after the procedure. I even remember every single line my uncle and I filled out on the paperwork. The only singular area that was left up to me with no encouragement or discouragement from my uncle was which procedure I would be getting. The popular route, which proved to be a painless route, involved taking a client's mind and storing it in a database while a body was being made for their mind to dwell in. The other route, although it involved a degree of pain, proved to have no disconnection from the nerves, which often occurred with the digital mind transfer route. One memory, one that causes me to hold dear to is a fantasy. In the last week before the procedure, I fantasized myself as a woman lying in the arms of my uncle. It would be taboo for my male self, but there was I, getting off on the idea of my uncle having sex with me in a female body. I had the feeling of intense impatient for that moment, which had to be disturbed by my headache.

When I wake up, the headache has completely subsided and there is no evidence of pain. I open my eyes and I find myself under the sheets and blankets on the mattress in the master bedroom. A cool, damp cloth is draped over my forehead and it feels like I'm not wearing the nightie anymore. Instead, I'm wearing something that doesn't make me feel like I'm walking around in just my undies. When I uncover the covers over my body, I find that my torso is comfortably garnished with a tank top. Covering some clean-feeling undies is a pair of short shorts. My legs are still bare, but at least there is an extra layer of protection over my more important parts.

I take the damp cloth from my forehead and set it down on the nightstand beside the bed. There I find a handwritten note from Niko, my uncle. The note reads, "I'm out on a big errand. Will be back in the evening. Love, Niko." For some reason, my eyes dwell on the words, "Love, Niko." My fantasy for my uncle submerges from the sea of memories that had flooded my smaller pond of a mind. I automatically imagine this body I'm living in for the rest of my life making love with a very handsome Uncle Niko. I notice my hand has wandered specifically between my legs, though not underneath any garments. Even above two different fabrics, I can still poke my sensitive parts.

I'm about to poke more when I hear a sound from outside the room. Could it be Niko back from his errand? So soon? I remove the covers as well as my hand from my crotch and get out of bed. Again, I notice that my headache is completely gone. I exit the room and find that the sounds is of the front door opening. It eventually opens, but unfortunately, my uncle does not walk through the threshold. Who walks in instead?

When I wake up, where do I find myself

There is no need, for there is some sort of apparatus on my face providing me air. Otherwise, I wouldn't be human, as I assume myself to be. I open my eyes and barely see anything. Before I can assume that I'm stuck in this pod with no way to escape, the light beneath me begins to changes to that of green and then to a pale yellow. The yellow then flashes, somewhat disorienting me. I close my eyes to help, but after I open them, the yellow light continues to flash before my eyes. Before I can get my question answers, something opens, which looks to be an exterior shield around

The light of the day and the warmth of the inside of the house suddenly changes as the gloved hand strikes my cheek. I'm sent keeling over onto my stomach, but it's not the hardwood floor of that house, but the wet uneven surface of asphalt. The warmth escapes into the cold of wherever I'm laying in. I look up and find a dumpster, large and full of refuse, threatening to unleash an overflowing flood of trash into what looks like an alley. Red brick walls flank my left and a large metal door painted in a faded olive color flanks my right. I can hear behind me the sounds of a busy street, unconcerned with the matters this alley possesses and deals with. 135333331.title: Dark Alley

The pet clinic
"Hardware"
1353333311.content:
The moment I get to my feet, I feel discomfort around my abdomen. Instinctively, I feel around with my hand, but just by touch, my stomach feels wet. My whole front was soaked by a puddle, which I found myself laying in. In the dim lighting of the alley, when I remove my hand, I assume I will just find my wet, saturated in water. However, when I look down, I find my hand drenched in a dark liquid. I suddenly have an coppery taste in my mouth, which always accompanied an experience where I visually saw blood and even when I was near it.

The discomfort I initial feel slowly becomes fatigue, since my shirt, which seems to be white originally, is saturated in dark red. I can't tell really, whether this wound was caused by a gun shot or a knife, but whatever it is, it's making me bleed profusely. What circumstances would have happen to have me wounded like this? I manage to get to a four way intersection, which branches out into three more alleyways. Though my eyes fail me due to my injury, I can make out three doors lit by their own lamps, one a few steps down each new alleyway.

The first alleyway, which is to my left, has the back door of a clinic. What kind of clinic, I'm not sure of. The middle alleyway, directly in front of me, has a vague sign that reads "hardware." The third alleyway, to my right, has a different type of clinic, one for pets.

Which door should I go to for help?
1353333311.title: Near Death

choices: I'm in the body of a woman
I wake up standing up, looking down at a man with a wounded abdomen
I'm in the body of a male that I do not recognize as myself
13533333111.content:
Though not a hospital, I feel a clinic would be the best bet for having materials and maybe even people who know how to treat a wound. I just hope there is people there just to open the door. I struggle to get down the alleyway, using whatever to keep myself upright and off the ground. Whether that be using the edge of the dumpster as a railing, leaning against the walls just to catch a breath and using planks of discard wood as walking sticks. A small obstacle sits in my path: a short flight of narrow steps with a flimsy-looking railing that looks like it would tear off its foundations with the slightest amount of weight placed on it.

When I get to the steps, I discard the plank of wood I was using, and instead of using the railing to support myself as I ascend the steps, I leaning myself against the wall. Eventually, I get to the door. I knock on it with a fist, which makes my knock become a furious banging, unintentionally. I also mistakenly put some of my blood on the door as well as I bang it. Now I wait. I wait for the door to open. At the very least, I'm waiting for someone to shun me, to tell me this exit is off-limits and that I'm on private property and potentially facing a trespassing charge if I don't leave soon.

To my surprise, I don't receive any of the worst I just thought up. In fact, as I lean against the door, unbeknownst to myself that I'm smearing likely blood evidence all over the door, I hear footsteps on the other side of it. Without warning, the door opens inward and my weight unintentionally forces the door open even further. Whoever opened the door must not be that strong even to support the dead weight of a near-dead adult man. Without his needed strength, I simply fall to the floor, my eyes darting to a dark ceiling.

I'm so fatigued that the sheer force of my non-invited drop onto the clinic's floor knocks me into a half-conscious state. The next moments are blurry, but I can tell that I'm being dragged further into the clinic. I can see that it's dimly lit, which tells me this clinic is supposed to be closed. This person dragging me must be here late, but on what is a mystery to me. I have no concern on what he's actually doing this late at night. I have more concern on my current wounded state and wondering if this person would be generous enough to stitch me up and medicate me with no charge. I wonder if I'm the first customer to come to his establishment thinking that this humble clinic was an emergency room. Then again, I wonder if this a usual thing for him. What does that say about this person? What does that say about me?

How did I get this wound? Who did I infuriate enough to them to cause harm to me in the bloodiest of forms? And how did I get away? And am I still on the run with people close by on my trail?

The last thing I remember before blacking out is that I'm lifted onto a table or elevated cushion, like those in kids' doctors' offices. I must be making a mess of it with my wound and for that, I believe I owe this Samaritan, whether good or of the shady sort, some form of appreciation or payment.

When I wake up though, I'm surprised to find that...?
13533333111.title: The Clinic

choices: A man in a dress shirt and slacks, typing on a computer
A woman wrapped in a towel, walking out of what seems to be a bathroom
A German Shepherd, laying in his comfy bed
135333331111.content:
I wake up feeling well-rested with no ounce of fatigue or hurt in my body. Before I open my eyes, I feel like I'm resting on a firm, yet soft cloud covered by a thick blanket. I can tell that I'm naked, but what can one do to make sure a wound is treated and stitched up. I bet it's to further promote good health, since those clothes I was wearing, when they got wet, were heavy and constricting. I breathe in what feels like cool air, but not as cold as the air in that alley. It smells cleaner too. With my ears, I hear the sounds of some place far from the bustling sounds of a city. There is a slight breeze, which whistles a bit as well.

I finally open my eyes and discover that this bed I'm laying on is covered by a roof and its sides are enclosed with opaque drapes. This is like the kind of bed a princess would have. The moment I push myself up into a sitting position, I find that I'm somewhere much different. I'm not referring to this unfamiliar bed in a place that's far from that alleyway I found myself in. What I'm referring to is much more personal. I can't explain it, but when I sit up, I'm surprised by the weight hanging off my chest. The blanket falls, reveal two globes, large enough that I can cup them with my hands, but a bit bigger and with a certain buoyancy. Fleshy mounds like these would only be found on a woman. But I'm a man though, I think to myself.

As I observe my chest, the hair attached to my head falls in front of my face and as if by instinct, I take the wayward locks of brunette hair and tuck whatever I can behind my ears. I have to catch myself, knowing such an action is used by those with long hair, women included. I myself have never had long hair, choosing to cut it short whenever I have the chance to go to a barber. But to do an action that is equally unfamiliar with waking up to find female breasts on my chest is disconcerting.

I pull off the covers, less out of curiosity and more out of concern, hoping that I'm not fully a part of the female species. But lo and behold, when the blanket is taken off, I find two shapely legs attached to a wide pelvis and an absence of a manhood between my legs. To replace it, I feel the doorway to a female reproductive system. What happened last night? What happened that caused me to find myself in this unfamiliar place in an equally unfamiliar body. All I remember is getting to a clinic and someone opening the door for me. Did that person bring me to make me.... this? Instead of helping a guy out with his wound, I'm turned into a woman?

Whatever the reason, I sure there is a bigger reason why I'm a woman, and most of them are ones where I'm at a disadvantage. There is no positive outcome in this situation. Wherever this place is, I need to get out. Vulnerable I was with the bloody wound, but as a woman, I find myself to be much more vulnerable.

I crawl over to the end of the bed. I lightly use my head to part the drapes aside so that I can see what's beyond it and before I can observe with my eyes, I hear something. I can't really tell what it is, but it sure tells me that I'm not alone in this room. When I peek my head out to see who or what is in the room, I discover it to be a...?
135333331111.title: Feminine

choices: Take his offer and ask for a warm bath
Take his offer and ask him to prepare the shower
Refuse and simply put on some clothes
1353333311111.content:
From what I can see from my position, this man embodies the tall, dark and handsome type of guy. Dressed in business attire, I can tell he has a high-paying job, one that can afford to live in a modern house like this. I'm distracted by the high ceiling, which has a skylight right in the center of it, where bright natural sunlight comes in at at angle and hits the walls. My attention draws back to the man who continues to type in his computer. I cannot tell what he is working on, but it sure looks like a report of some kind considering how fast his fingers hit the keys. I also observe, draped on the office hair he is sitting on, a white lab coat reminiscent of a doctor's coat. Could he be the person who opened the door to the clinic and dragged my wounded body inside? And could he be the one who put me in this body? And what of my original, wounded, male body? What did he do to that? Even when I'm reluctant to interact with this person, he is the sole person who has the answers to my questions.

Before I do that, I have to get out of the bed. I swing my feet over the end of the bed and slowly try to lower myself. Before I can even meet the floor, the man speaks, asking, "You ought to put some clothes on before you leave the bed, my dear." He has the nerve to address me as, 'his dear,' but he's right. Who in his... her right mind wants to leave a covered bed in a stranger's house with no clothes. Must be the man in me.

I pull my legs back onto the bed and then peek my head back out again. I see the man get up from his chair and turn to look at me. Seeing his face, I'm correct in him being of the tall, dark and handsome type. In fact, he's tall, tan-skinned, handsome and I can also tell he takes care of his body. Not that I'm attracted to him, though, just observing the facts. He walks over to a table next to an open window and retrieves a paper bag. He also takes a garment hanging on the back of the chair with him as well. He then walks over to where I'm peeking from behind the white drape and sets the bag down next to the bed. He also hands the dark garment directly to me. "Now, if you want, you can freshen up in the shower or I can draw a bath for you," he mentions.

I take the garment from him, but at once I ask, "You turn me into a woman and you offer me your bathroom. For what reason?"

"Just a friendly favor," he says. I noticed he did not deny him turning me into a woman. "I know you have your assumptions and you have a whole lot of questions, but consider this. You've had a terrible night and you've woken up in someplace different. Why not relax yourself from all your worries with a hot shower or warm bath? Afterwards, I'll be available to answer any questions you may have. Do note that there is some clothes in this bag you can put on." He then leaves and goes back to work at his computer.

What should I do? Take him up on his offer? Or refuse? In any case, being naked for the rest of my life like a woman (if it turns out to be that way in the end) does not sound inviting. What should I do?
1353333311111.title: Dr. Murao

choices: The first button
The second button
The third button
13533333111112.content:
Before he gets to his office chair to sit down, I call out to him, "Actually... can you turn on the shower for me, please?"

"I was wrong in assuming you wouldn't use the magic word, but here you are using it," he says, though in a rather annoying way. I watch him happily walk from his desk to the right wall, where he disappears. All I can hear is the sound of water rushing down from a shower head. The man then reappears and says, "It's ready for you," before going back to his desk.

I remove myself from the side of the drape and stretch out the garment he gave me. It turns out to be a bath robe, made out of a light material, probably of silk or satin. I put it on, feeling the cool softness of the fabric against my skin. I tie the included band, made out of the same fabric, around my waist so that most of my private areas are covered and not exposed. I part the drapes once more, this time to get to the floor of the rather high bed, as if I'm coming down from a cloud. When my feet touch the floor, the man doesn't say anything to annoy me. I look over and he continues to work on his computer. I wonder what he's workng on, I think to myself.

I grab the bag and approach the middle of the room, turning right into the alcove that has a mounted, floating, folding partition. The alcove has all the amenities of an elite master bathroom. A ornate, modern sink with a large mirror that matches the width on the sink and countertop, which is made out of a pearly-white granite. Opposite the sink and counter is a bathtub that has jets like a jacuzzi. If I was to choose this option, it would really make me relax, maybe even further as it releases the emotional tension in my body. Flanking the tub is a bidet. To those that have never heard or seen on of these, it's like a toilet but with extra features, more notably the addition of a spout that provides a spray of water on soiled assholes, literally. I probably won't be using that today. Last, but certainly not least, is the shower. I had assumed it was a simple shower with a single showerhead. My mouth gapes in awe at a shower that I've only seen in commercials.

I make sure to lock the partition, one to hide my body once I've taken off my bath robe and two, to hide my amazement of such a collection of fixtures. I make note of where the towels are and make my way into the shower. Compared to the tub, this shower is fully enclosed, the entrance of which is made of semi-transparent glass, which already has condensation on the inside part due to the steam from the hot water. At the moment, there is only one showerhead on, but I can see about a dozen, if not more, nozzles fixed into the absolute black granite that lines the three walls. Before me, below the mounted main showerhead, that can be removed and used as a handheld faucet, is a panel of smooth buttons. Before I can press any of those buttons, I walk underneath the flow of water from the showerhead, which douses me in hot water. Uncontrollably, I yelp with my high-pitched voice and I hold my mouth to prevent any more yelps to escape. No doubt that initial sound was heard by the man outside.

And indeed he heard it and thought I was having trouble. "Are you okay in there?" he asks as he calls out.

I call back, "I'm okay. I'm just not used to this kind of shower." I wonder what his expression is like right now, after he has impressed someone like me with his fancy shower. I bet he has a smile on his face, the corners of his mouth rising from cheek to cheek.

I catch my breath as I try to calm myself down. It wasn't the heat of the water that surprised me, but the fact that the water on this female body... feels good. I move under the flow of water once more, making sure to breath in and out so that I don't scream out in ecstasy for a second time. As I do, the flow of the water soaks my long brunette hair and flows against every part of my skin. Most especially along the skin of my breasts and against the front door of my pelvis. It's pretty hard trying to keep the male part of my mind from going insane.

Once I'm drenched and used to the temperature of the water, my curiosity, now fired up, causes me to investigate the panel of buttons, three of which are tempting to press. The first one, has a letter "U" in bold font on it. The second button has a sort of icon on it that is reminiscent of the cross of a scope on a gun. I wonder if that means it will shoot out a jet of water at me. The third one has the word "FULL," which is also written in bold font. I have an idea what that would entail.

Which of the three button should I press?
13533333111112.title: Stranger's Shower

choices: End my shower and exit
Experiment with the "U" button
Try to rub the sensations away
135333331111123.content:
I press the third button and anticipate a whole deluge of water to be dumped on me. When I press the button, what happens in the next few moments, while the main showerhead stays on, is that every spout or nozzle that I see turns on one by one until I have gallons of water rushing about my body. Each nozzle has its own setting on how it shoots out the water. While some are large amounts of soft, there is a balance between that and just a bit of sharp jets. The light of streams comes from below me, for instead of a drain, there is yet another spout that lightly laps between my legs. I feel like I'm underneath a waterfall, but instead of cool island river water, it's more the temperature of hot springs water mixed with a bit of sun-baked ocean water.

I can't help but relax, as I turn around and around until every part of my sensitive exterior has been touched by the wonderful streams. I inhale and exhale deeply, as my more sensitive of areas are gently touched. Now trying to stay sane as a man in a female body is turning out to be impossible. I push the FULL button once more and the separate spouts and nozzle discontinue their streams, leaving the main one on.

I step out of the stream and lean against the wall, trying to get my bearings with this wonderful bathroom fixture. I close my eyes and I cannot believe how I can remember so detailed a detail. The downpour of warm rain fall on my breasts, bouncing droplet left and right and down in between the two mounds. And that underside spout. It start hitting my crotch and blanketing my asshole but doing much more with my unfamiliar snatch. It was as if an aquatic hand was gently running its soft finger upon it. My mind wanders and eventually finds itself thinking of the man outside, a smile on his face and the thought snaps me out of my reverie.

I turn off the shower and watch the water drain into circular hoops that surrounding the only nozzle that would have been my downfall as a man if it had been the only one I turned on, which makes me eye the U button. I can see why this man has it, but did he consider a woman using this shower and getting a whole different benefit from it. Would he know? Would he be curious? Do I even want to know those things? My reverie brings me back to reality as I'm reminded of the many question I have. I calm myself down, again taking deep breaths in and out.

Then again, the sensations are still there, albeit faint. Only a hint is remaining. What should I do now?
135333331111123.title: Wonderfully Water-FULL

choices: A long maxi dress made of light material
A short dress that barely covers my bottom
Just a bra and matching thong
13533333111113.content:
I remove myself from the edge of the bed all while I lift the bag of clothes from the floor and onto the bed. Judging from the weight, there is not much here, but on first glance, it looks like it's full of clothing. Just what kind of clothing is the question. Heck, this guy could be playing me and the only thing he's put in the bag is a dress. On the other hand, there could be clothes made of the lightest of materials and it's just a bunch of fabric taking up the space. Then again, he could be fooling me with what looks like clothes, but it's useless things that I can't even wear.

So what will it be? What will I find in this bag?
13533333111113.title: Dress Up

choices: Dare to go higher with the heels
Stay safe in the wedges and add height and stability to my feet
Go the safe route with the flat-soled gladiators
135333331111131.content:
At first glance, the beige material seems to take up the majority of the bag. It looks like a fine towel just to cover what's below it. But when I pull it out, it's like pulling one of those rope ladders made of handkerchiefs that magicians use as a gag for laughs. When the garment is totally out, all that is left is smaller piece of fabric, which turns out to be a pair of panties in a dark brown color. I discard the bag and stretch out the major garment, which turns out to be what ladies call a maxi dress. It's like a casual gown usually worn during summer.

Without observing the overall look of the dress, I put it on, figuring to insert my head through the very middle hole and my arms through the holes flanking the middle. In retrospect, I notice a lot more holes that didn't seem to be used for anything. When I finally have it on, I realize those holes were for decoration. The top portion of the dress is more or less like a high-cut, female version of a vest. My whole back is covered, so it's not like a halter top. What is exposed, however, is my neckline as well as a generous amount of cleavage. The collar forms a "V" where the intersecting point is about an inch below my bust line. A small hole sits below the V to expose a bit of my stomach. Two holes flank the either side of this to expose my sides and a bit of my back. The lower portion is basically the rest of the dress, which flows straight down and should bunch up at my feet. I notice two slits for my legs at either side of my gown. Each separate about an inch or two below my waist and if I stand, it would certainly show off my legs. I guess the remaining thing to do is to put my panties on to cover something else up.

Once I'm done dressing up, I part the drapes and make my way to the floor. To my surprise, I see the man out of his seat and standing in the middle of the room. In his hands he holds up three pairs of shoes. In one hand he holds two heeled shoes. The first is a strappy high heel with a bit of a platform underneath the ball of the foot, which in turn gives it a higher heel. Looks to be about five inches in length from tip to heels. The other shoe is similar in design, but instead of a pointy heel, it has a block wedge, which has a flat sole underneath it. In his other hand, he holds a flat-soled sandal. I believe the sandals are called gladiators, similar to the footwear used by gladiators in an Roman arena. On his face is an astonished smile. "Wow, you look great in that dress," he says, amused.

"You're getting off on this real well, aren't you?" I ask, annoyed at his amusement..

"I realized you needed one more piece to complete your look, but I'll give you a choice," he says to me. "Either dare yourself and wear a pair of heels, ease yourself for heels with the wedges, or go safe and wear the flats, which are much nicer than flip flops, in my opinion."

"I would easily go for flip flops," I shoot back.

"Come on, be a good sport," he tells me. "I'm giving you a chance to be--" he start, but I interrupt him, mainly because his phrasing hits a nerve.

"To be a woman? Maybe to be your woman? What was your reason for turning a man into a woman?" I shoot off on him.

"You were wounded and bleeding--" he starts, but I interrupt him a slap, which causes his glasses to fall to the floor and break. The shattering of one of the lenses silences the room. He may have went too far in turning me into a woman, but in a social aspect, me slapping him was me going too far in my frustration. The man transfers the gladiator sandals to the hand holding the other two pairs of shoes and then bends down to retrieve his glasses from the floor.

A guilty knot forms in my stomach. It's one thing to slap a man, but to break something that helps him see is a whole different thing. "Sorr--" I try to apologize, but he too interrupts me, in his own gentle way.

"No worries," he interjects. "In a way, I'm sorry as well. I did not get your consent, but it was your urgency to be treated and your half-conscious state that obliged me to do what I had to do." He looks at the broken pair of glasses in his free hand and tosses it onto an arm chair. "You would have died if i didn't do anything."

In a calm, yet critical voice, I ask, "Why a woman?"

"It was the only option. That clinic was just a clinic you see. I had experimental equipment that enable me to transfer your consciousness into that body you are now using. She was a nobody, mainly because she was an investment from someone. She wasn't born. She was made and whoever made her accelerated her age in just six months time. I did not know I could do it, but I did and you were the finished product," he explains. "Sorry if that makes you feel like an object."

As he explained his bit, I closed my eyes trying to calm the anger directed more at the situation.and less on this man. A question pops up. "If I'm an investment, then am I someone's property? Was this body meant for someone else?" I ask.

The man pauses to think about his answer. I bet he has to since his blurting out of answer has gotten him a furious woman and a broken pair of glasses. "It wasn't meant for anybody. In actuality, I had no one to transfer their consciousness into it," he tells me.

"So," I start, "spur of the moment?"

"Pretty much. If you hadn't came along, my last resort was to become... her... myself," he struggles to say.

"I see," I say, understanding a bit of what makes the matter profound. "Potentially, if you were in this body, you probably wouldn't have the clinic."

"Who knows where I could've been," he adds, which causes a silence in the room. Our gazes wander to trivial objects in the room. Our expressions are that of the unconcerned. I move my gaze to the three pairs of shoes in his other hand. I silent approach the man without looking at him. I reach over and lift up his wrist look at the choices he's given me.

Should I go for the heels, which has benefits of giving me more height while keeping the maxi dress from bunching up at the bottom and potentially tripping me when I walk? Potentially, I have a slight disadvantage with the heels, due to unfamiliarity in wearing them, I can trip on myself or hurt myself by rolling my ankle. How about the wedges, which has the same benefits as the heels, but without the disadvantage. You can say the wedges have qualities of both the heels and the flats. Or should I take the sandals, which has the benefits of better balance than a heeled shoes, but with the disadvantage of tripping on my own dress?
135333331111131.title: Maximum Woman

choices: At a beachside BBQ
In his own kitchen, though with a hired cook
In a penthouse restaurant
1353333311111311.content:
I grab the whole bunch of shoes from the man's hand and put them down on the ground. After a bit of deliberating, I pick up the pair of heels and turn on my heels to sit down in the arm chair. The man just stands in place, probably just to watch me put on the heels, but I don't mind.

I part the front of the skirt a bit to expose my smaller feet and insert one into the correct shoe. I have to insert my feet through two sets of triple straps before my toes, the ball of my feet as well as my heel can be seated in their appropriate areas. The shoe has peek-a-boo effect with my toes and exposes much of the top of my foot, but not too much. Plus, the color scheme of the heels sort of matches my outfit, since the primary is a light tan or beige with the secondary being a black color. The shoes do not have to be fastened or anything, since with the stretchy straps, with my feet inserted, they keep them in the heels rather than potentially falling off with every step. I do the same with the other foot.

At first, I try to push off the arms of the armchair to get to my feet, but I find it difficult. The man comes at the right time to offer his hand, which I gladly take and he pulls me to my feet. He sort of pushes too hard and I lose my balance and tip over into him. He catches me though, asking, "You got it?" while pushing back to keep me upright.

Once I get my balance, I say, "Thank you for that." I look up and notice i'm about five inches taller, able to see into his throat if I were to be comparing my height with his. Without the heels, his tall stature would tower over me and I would only be able to see his chest if I was looking straight at him at the lower height. I let go of his hand and try my hand at walking. Just to make sure I don't fall and hurt myself, he stays close, ready to catch me at the right moment.

In actuality, I don't need the help, for I notice right away, if I walk as if I'm on a tightrope and keep the platform underneath the balls of my feet and the tip of the heel on the ground, I'll be fine walking. From the armchair, I walk over to the bed. From the bed, turn on my heel and walk back to the armchair.

"How is it?" the man asks.

"It'll take getting used to, but I think I can manage," I tell him. "Say, why shoes? Are you taking me out?"

"It's not a date, if that's what you're referring to," the man says. "I just figured, with you being out for three days---" I have to interrupt him because of that mind-boggling length.

"I've been out for three days?" I ask.

"It takes a while for the consciousness to fill the whole body," he tells me. "Every nerve in the body has to connect to the consciousness within it. This is why you're not sore or anything."

"Everything feels..." I start.

But he finishes, "As it's supposed to feel. Three days in bed, I might as well take you out to eat brunch. You must be starving."

As a matter of fact, I am. As a kind gesture, and as I'm hoping he will help me stabilize as I walk, I wrap my arm around his own. "So where are we eating?
1353333311111311.title: A Bit Higher

choices: A large wedding party has reserved the whole beach area and is closed
The man recognizes Allen and directs him to the owner
The beach is closed due to incoming weather
13533333111113111.content:
"I'm thinking someplace relaxing, like a beach," he tells me.

"You do know I'm wearing heels, mister," I mention. He acknowledges it with a joking smile. "And what food do we get at the beach? Don't tell me we have to catch it ourselves."

"You'll see," he says and doesn't say anything. He leaves my side to disappear behind a door.

"What are you doing?" I ask as I knock on the door. In the meantime, I walk a bit more in the heels, just trying to get a feel for them. Most certainly, if I was still a man and I wore these heels, no doubt will I find myself sprawl on the floor. I look at the window and find it open. Since we are going out, not on a date of course, we might as well lock these windows up. Before I do so, however, the man reappears as he opens the door, dressed in different clothes. He comes out wearing a pair of shorts with a button-up shirt, which he has a zip-up hoodie worn over it.

"Hey, leave that for the maid. She comes in about an hour," the man tells me.

"Okay," I simply say and turn on my heel and meet up with him. I discover he's holding a bunch of blankets. I ask, "What with all the blankets?"

"I remember the place we are going to has a rule that you have to B.Y.O.B.," he tells me.

"B.Y.O.B.?" I ask, repeating the acronym. After putting the sight of the blankets together with the four letters, I come up with, "Bring Your Own... Blanket?"

"Exactly," he assures me. He hands me a throw blanket, similar in color with my outfit. "If memory serves me right, it can get pretty cold over there, so I'm bringing extra." With two blankets in his arms, I cannot hold onto his arm for stability, but I don't fear anything since I've been practicing for a bit. I just have to be extra careful.

He leads me out of the room and into the hallway. In this one hallway, there is only one other door here and it leads into a maintenance closet. The man does the honor of telling me everything about his house, which turns out to be pretty big. The closet has a hatch with stair steps that can be used to access the roof, mostly for workers to clean the skylight that I'm about to see once in a while. Other things like the floor's water heater is inside as well.

At the end of the hallway, the space opens up and I'm amazed at a large hole. On the edges of the hole is a banister that keeps anyone from falling through the hole. In actuality, this whole space near the hole is cylindrical and it's like an open hallway, with doors branching out to different rooms. Instead of giving me a tour of the house, the man leads me down the staircase, as if he's impatient of me trying to see his house.

I make my way down the spiral staircase that is contained the hole. With the blanket roll in one hand, pressed against my hips, I use my other hand to stabilize myself by utilizing the railing. I make my way one step at a time, the heels giving me the benefit of not stepping on my dress and falling down the stairs as a consequence. It a bit of a struggle, since I'm literally tip-toeing down to every step, but cannot put my heels down because of a tall and slender heel preventing it doing so. After about two minutes or so, I make it down the long, windy staircase.

The man waits for me at the bottom and leads me to the garage, which is down another hallway, which is a left at the bottom of the stairs. Along the way, I see another office to the right and opposite that a full-sized kitchen. I ask the man, "Do you cook?"

"Not that much. I can only cook some basic dishes. That's why I hire my chef friend when I feel like eating in," he tells me as he leads me down the hallway. I pass three doors that lead to other rooms before we get to the fourth door, which leads into the garage. To my surprise, it's not the kind of garage that I imagined. It looks nothing like the rest of the house: neat, tidy, clean. "Forgive the mess. The people I employ to do maintenance and housekeeping stay away from the garage. Mainly, because I like it that way."

The garage is long and seems to curve to contour the house it's built against. There are about three cars in this garage that are covered by car covers. I ask the man about it, "Do you drive these cars that are covered?"

"Sometimes, but I can only focus on one," he tells me and leads me to the one car that isn't covered. It sits in the front of the line of cars in the garage, the first to leave out the door. It's a Jeep, from what I can tell and it sits on massive off-road tires. The tires aren't gigantic, but they're big enough to raise the profile of the jeep several inches. A conveniently placed sidestep is installed to help people get into the jeep. The vehicle has four door, so it can carry an additional two to three people in the back, but since it's just the two of us, we just toss the blankets in the back.

The man opens the garage doors and lets a slight breeze blow through. It kicks up the skirt of my dress, but not by much. The wind does remind me that my legs are totally bare, with only a pair of panties to keep something else warm and cozy. Knowing that I have heels on, the man assist me in getting into the jeep. He offers his hand and opens the passenger door wide so I can get in with no worry of my outfit snagging on anything. He makes it obvious that this doesn't make this moment a date, saying, "I'm just helping a woman get into a tall Jeep, okay? Just put your foot here and pull against that handle up there." I put the platform of the shoe on the sidestep, with the heel of my shoe hanging in mid-air. I put all my weight on the platform and not the heel part. I see two handles in the top corners of the door frame. I reach up and pull on those and using just one hand, the man assist my rising into the seat by supporting my buttocks. When I'm in the seat with no malfunction with my maxi dress or my heels, I'm just glad that I'm able to sit in this car. I don't protest in the man using a hand to feel upon my buttocks.

He closes the door for me and then rounds the front of his jeep to get to the driver's side. He climbs in and turns over the engine, which, to be able to turn those massive wheels, a powerful engine is needed. The roar of the engine impresses me, causing me to smile. I ask him as he puts the truck into gear, "Do you take this off-roading?"

"I wanted to, but my job doesn't give me enough time to," he tells me as he pulls the jeep out of the garage and pushes a button to close said garage. He navigates through the driveway and eventually to the street and then to the highway.

Along the way, I get to the know the man who put me in this body. His name is Allen Murao and he's a doctor at a clinic. He mostly deals with physical therapy and rehabilitation. His clientele mostly consist of athletes who have gotten injuries while playing their respective sports and he works to get them back into shape so they can rejoin the competition. He also tells me he also had experience and an unknown talent for neuro-science, which is why someone invested this body that I now control and some experimental equipment in order to do what he did. He also told me he was given a timeline to complete it, but he had no clue what to do. When I showed up at his clinic that one night, it was an opportunity for him to complete his work.

"So, me showing up at your door that one night, I was like a godsend then?" I ask.

"I don't think that would be called a godsend. It was an opportunity, one that I was stressed about going through with it. Heck, you were bleeding onto my floor and my floor doesn't even get that much blood on it. I could have done something to patch you up, but it was only to get you out of my clinic and on your way. I doubt I would have the skills to heal your wound," he explains.

"And that's why you put me in this body? Knowing that I would die by my injuries if you didn't put my consciousness in a living body," I deduce.

"Pretty much," he agrees.

We enter a tunnel that bores through a forested hill. While we drive inside the tunnel, we pause from conversation and think about the things we just talked about. I try to put myself in his shoes. If I had the means to do what he did in transferring my consciousness from one body to another and I was presented with this stressful opportunity, I probably would have chosen the same route. I feel like he's trying to deal with it and I would do the same if I was in his position. He's pretty much dealing with the fallout. Me, my frustrations, my anger at him for doing something like he did. As we come out of the tunnel, which replaces the yellow tunnel lights with natural sunlight, I gently say, "You had no choice." Somehow I can feel that he is agreeing with me in a silent way. I think I can also sense that he is nodding to my comment.

Allen exits off the highway and gets to a dusty street. Eventually, we come to this gate, where a large man with a friendly face is standing with a clipboard in his hand. What does this man have to say?
13533333111113111.title: BYOB

choices: A wedding party has taken most of the restaurant
Nothing out of the ordinary
Our elevator stops two floors below the penthouse level
13533333111113113.content:
"Well, since we are both dressed up, I think it would be counter-productive to go to a casual place. I think we'll have to go to someplace more class. You're lucky I know of a good place where they make omelets," he tells me.

"A classy place that makes omelets? You're joking, right?" I ask him.

"No, not at all," he says. "It's in a penthouse level in the city."

"Well, I certainly don't know much of this place," I mention.

"You don't live here?" he asks me.

"All I remember is that three nights ago, I was wounded and bleeding in an alley and I happened to find your clinic and you invited me in--" I start and the man finishes.

"By dragging you," he finishes. "And you don't remember anything other than that?"

I try to recall anything else, but ultimately, I simply say, "No. Nothing."

"Your consciousness was transferred, but not your memories. Or maybe you have a bit of amnesia and your memories are just in shock," he suggests.
