“I will be your benefactor. I have spoken to the warden and bribed him with a million dollar. Unfortunately, the most I could take off your sentence is five years,” the man explains.

“That's twenty years left on my sentence. Since there will be no more prisons, how do I serve my sentence, as a woman, since I'm under the Apathy Clause?” I continue to ask.

“How's being my secretary sound?”

“Like an office secretary?”

“Not like the stereotype,” he tells me. “If you don't know, a secretary manages all the behind-the-scenes activity of their respective bosses. They manage correspondence with clients and business partners, screen incoming communications and inform their boss of any and all updates, both positive and negative. It's a demanding job. I'm willing to shorten your sentence if you do well.”

“So I'm just going to be your secretary, nothing else, correct?” I ask.

“What do you mean?” he asks, but quickly understands my implication. “Oh, no. I have no need of a partner or wife or mistress. Though you will live on my estate, the relationship between us is of boss and employee. Nothing more, nothing less. Plus, I already have a wife.” I was expecting an answer such as his from someone as experienced as he. He raises his head, somehow noticing my visible relief that I won't be his significant other. “So what will it be? You do know that if you do not take my offer, you will join the fate of the other men on the those other planes.”

I didn't know before, but after he has told me, I'm glad I know. The choices he's given me is clear, but somehow, I'm concerned for the unconscious man sitting beside me. “What will happen to Garcia?” I ask the older man.

“Do not concern yourself with the likes of men like him. Gangs have been a blight on society. Where he will be, he won't have to benefit of friends that have his back. Where he will be, he will not have a choice like the one's I've given you,” he explains, but doesn't quite explain fully what his plans for Garcia are. He pauses to look at some behind me. Before I can look back to see who it is, he speaks up. “Seems we are ready to leave, but still, I'd like to know what your choice will be.”

What should I choose? Should I choose a generic fate like the rest of the men on the other planes? Or should I take up the man's offer of being his female secretary?
1353333321113.title: Benefactor's Offer

choices: Take a look at the contents inside the SD card
Take a peek outside the window
Head into the bathroom to freshen up
13533333211131.content:
"If I choose to become your secretary, you said that you will be my benefactor? What does that mean?" I ask the bearded man.

The plane's engines whine as they spool up, gradually building in rotational speed. The plane's stairs are also retracted and the door closed as well. A woman from the nose end of the plane comes behind and me and without warning, she rolls up one of my sleeve, exposing my forearm and elbow. She vigorously checks for a vein. The man calms me down by placing a hand on one of my knees. He explains to me the meaning of the benefactor term he used, successfully distracting and taking my attention away from the woman. "As a man with wealthy, I've pleaded to turn one of the prisoners, you in this case, into what the Apathy Clause states is a "Charge," or a person under my responsibility. Like a child for example. As Benefactor, I will pay for your identity, your shelter, your meals along with a certain degree of freedom. Yes, you will still be serving your sentence, but fortunately it will be in a more gentler setting. You get to experience both sides of the Clause, if you'll be my secretary of course."

"I guess I don't have a choice. I'll do it," I say, but once I say it, the needle that the woman is now holding, find a suitable place in my arm to insert her needle, which is filled with a pinkish liquid. I can only groan out in discomfort. Before I could protest, the liquid is injected into my bloodstream. "What they hell? Why do I feel so cold, yet hot in places?" I ask, somewhat feeling myself drift into a drunken state.

The woman speaks up, "As per the analogue route, we've injected your first dose of nanites, tiny robots that alter your body at the cellular level. They use your body heat as power and will gradually change your cells from male to female as they use some cells as fuel for the change.” The woman reclines my chair while a guard comes and unlocks my cuffs and removes them from my wrists and ankles. “It will be a short flight, but the best you can do is relax. I hardly can see any of the action I'm hearing, since all I can do is look to my side, towards the observation deck's railing, into a thick canopy of a forest or jungle. The next sounds I hear is of heavy footfalls, boots running down the deck and possibly jumping over David's body covering mine. I hear sounds of rifles shoot in the direction of the cannon and before I know it, another explosion erupts, this time farther. Did the people with the feet running on the deck have rifles and shot down the unseen attacker?

I hear the voices of men shouting. From what I can make out, the men say, "Get search teams down there!" "Get that fucker!"

It's at the same time the men are shouting when David finally pushes himself off of me. I look up at him and it looks like the side that was facing me is unscathed. It's when he turns around to respond to a man dressed in tactical gear and carrying a rifle, when I see the damage just a bunch of debris could do to the human body. Concrete dust covers most of his skin and clothes and on his left arm, is a wound. Looks like it was caused by a grazing bullet, not as worse as a direct hit, but still gruesome.

"You okay, Lieutenant?" the geared-up man asked through his face mask.

"Nothing major, just a flesh wound," David answers.

"Good call on that one, Sir," the man comments.

David taps his temple, "Well, it's good I had these when I needed them. Bastards can cloak themselves, but with the right tech, nobody can see wear their hiding," he says.

"I'd have to buy you a drink one time. You going to be alright from here?" the guard asks.

"Like I said, just a flesh wound," David tells him. "Now go on, they need more eyes for that bastard. Make sure you find him and bring him back alive."

"Will do, Sir," the guard responds and turns on his heel to join his team.

David turns around and looks down at me. By now, I've already sat up, but due to the dust and tiny bits of glass in the areas around the space that David covered with his body, I cannot go anywhere without shoes to protect my feet. He sighs as he bends down and lifts me up into his arms. He winces as the weight of my legs burdens his left arm. Concerned, I ask, "Are you okay?"

As if he's pissed off about me being where I'm not supposed to be and getting him in trouble for it, he scoffs at my question. "What were doing out here anyway?" he asks in return.

"I wanted to explore--" I answer, but he cuts me off.

"--And look where that got you," he shoots at me, silencing me. I look away, embarrassed truly. My curiosity wounded a man who's extending his help by carrying me over shards of glass and concrete. He carries me all the way down the observation deck and back into the hallway where it's a panic. It seems the attack penetrated the interior and wrecked havoc here as well. When we get to the four-way intersection, two gurneys with one male and one female, both in lab coats, cross in the front of us. Judging from the blood soaking on half of the woman's lab coat, she took a terrible hit that makes David's wound much less major.

David continues to make his way with me in his arms through the chaos in the hallways. He get into an elevator which goes down a couple of levels. We exit into a hallway that looks unaffected by the tension two floors above. I look out the windows and find the upper parts of the canopy of what looks like a tropical jungle dominating the view. Even with the clear floor, David doesn't even let me get back on my feet. I can't even explain when I don't protest for him to put me down. Am I too ashamed of hurting the man that I would allow him to carry me all the way?

After rounding a corner, which would follow the same route as the observation deck, we come up to another corner. Through the windows, the view is much clearer with much less dense jungle outside. Dominating the view though is a plume of black smoke, possibly from the wreckage of the aircraft that shot at us. Opposite the large window that shows us the terrible scene outside is a door, which opens automatically when David walks near the sensors. Inside, we find...?

155131233211322321.content:
David and I are not even completely through the threshold of the door when we hear a scream and a woman shouting. David quickens his pace and rounds a partition to find William on his feet trying to calm a very panicked woman. Though clothed in pretty much the same type of outfit (only difference is her midriff is covered). she backs away from the large man as if she were naked and exposed. "Get away from me, you--!" she exclaims at the top of her lungs.

David drops the burdened arm holding up my legs and allows me to get to my feet. I run over to my father-turned-sister, who by now is up against a wall adjacent to the far end of the bed she had been laying on. I embrace her like I had when we were pinned underneath the bed during the earthquake and squeeze her for good measure. I speak into her ear, "Hey, hey, it's okay. We're safe." I turn my head to look at William and David talking. I assume David asked what happened. I assume that due to the explosions and possible vibrations, my father-turned-sister had enough stimuli that was able to wake her up from her long slumber. The screaming probably surprised poor William, who for a moment, looked like he didn't know what to do in that situation.

I rock my father-turned-sister back and forth, feeling the throbbing heart in her chest being to calm and relax, as I watch William asking about the wound on David's arm. He's probably advising him to get it looked at and tended to. Without saying goodbye or announcing their exit, they leave the room.

"Where are we?" my father-turned-sister asks.

"I don't know, but it seems like a military compound on an island. They have scientists working here too," I tell her. "Are you doing okay?"

"Apart from waking up here all of a sudden, I'm fine. What happened to the house?" she asks.

"Demolished, I think, but this place should a much better place to rest your head," I tell her. "Are you sure you're okay? You look like you didn't get much sleep."

"Wait, how long was I out?" she asks.

"I don't know how long, but I think you were out an hour or two more than I was," I tell her. "Say, you don't feel hot do you?"

"What do you mean?" she asks, feeling her forehead with the back of her hand.

"When you were asleep, some scientist told me that they can somehow explain how we were transformed into women. The technological stuff is a place they can't even fathom, but they have a theory that we changed according to thermodynamics."

"Thermodynamics?" she asks, taking a seat on the side of the bed.

"They said something along the line of heat close to that of radioactive plutonium mutated every cell in our body at the tiniest level and it was the technology in the glove that commanded the cells to switch from male to female," I further explain. "They even took a picture of our bodies in relation to the heat we are producing and we are white hot."

"You mean smoking hot," she says out of nowhere.

"Excuse me--?" I ask, but without warning, my father-turned-sister pushes me down onto the bed. Quickly, she straddles me all while pressing half of her weight down on my shoulders. "What are you doing?"

What does she do to me?

1551312332113223213.content:
While one of her hands stays planted on my shoulder, the weight of her upper body right over the arm, she takes her other hand and places her fingers on my exposed midriff. She traces along my belly button and slowly and seductively rises to the form fitting band of my sports bra. I look at her and see a sinister grin form on her lips, which, at the same pace as her hand, slowly start to lower itself towards mine. All of a sudden, the whistle that comes from the opening of the sliding door enters the room and my father-turned-sister looks towards it. Now that she is distracted, at that moment I push up against her and throw her to the side.

The footsteps belonging to our visitor draw closer, possibly to the edge of the partition. I take whatever time I have to push myself up to a sitting position. The visitor reveals himself to be the Indian scientist that I had met before.

"Hello," he greets the two of us with his accent. "I see your sister is awake."

"I'm not her sister," my father-turned-sister says, with a voice that shows no evidence that she had been panicking minutes beforehand. "I'm more like her mother."

"You mean her father?" the Indian man adds. The question catches her off guard and she cannot shoot back at him. I giggle a bit under my breath while seeing my father-turned-sister's face reddens in embarrassment. "It's okay. We had to do some testing why you two were asleep. It's been 47 hours since you were picked up on the west coast and transported her."

"Where's here?" I ask.

"Somewhere near the equator, surrounded by ocean, invisible to those not looking," he answers.

"Meaning that our location is classified?" I ask in return. "Then how come someone who was invisible came and attacked me a few minutes ago?"

"What are you talking about?" my father-turned-sister asks, curiosity written all over her face.

I don't answer her, which gives the Indian scientist a moment to answer my previous question. "Obviously that person was looking, intently searching for the place that protected you and they succeeded. We don't know how, but we are investigating at the moment. But that's not the reason why I came. I came her to let you know that we have caught the culprit and we are have the culprit restrained to a bed, where he or she is resting."

"You don't know if the attacker is a male or female?" I ask, puzzled by his answer. He pauses, as if he is trying to formulate something to say but after a little while, he chooses not to answer my question.

Instead, he continues. "We are holding the culprit right now, where he, or she, cannot hurt you. If you want, you can come with me to see her," he says. "Otherwise, you can stay here and we'll get you whatever you need."

"No, I'd like to see him... or her," I say.

"Me too," my father-turned-sister puts in. I look back at her, out of surprise. I turn back to the Indian scientist, who nods and takes a deep breath.

"Alright, I'll give you two some time to get ready---" he tells us, but I interrupt.

"We don't need to get ready," I cut him off.

"Very well, if you follow me, we'll get to the holding cells," he says and turns on his heel, disappearing behind the partition.

I get to my feet and hurry after him, with my father-turned-sister right on my heels. When we see him again, he's already in the hallway

"You know, we could have just took a minute to get some shoes or at the very least a pair of slippers, girl," my father-turned-sister says from behind me. Truly, after exploring an observation deck and hallways in my bare feet, I was already used to the feeling of the cold floor underneath my soles. My father-turned-sister wouldn't have experienced it since by now, she's been carried here and there. We make it to an elevator, which is the same elevator that David had carried me up in. When the doors close, my father-turned-sister asks the Indian scientist, "You don't happen to know where I can get some shoes for these itty-bitty feet, do you?"

"I'm sorry, your sister here was adamant that we not waste time in getting to the holding cells. If you want, I can get William to carry you to the holding cells," he tells her.

"Who's William?" she asks in return.

"I'm pretty sure you know him by now. He's been carrying you diligently, even when you got here, you were in his arms," the Indian man explains.

I add, whispering into her ear, "he was the one you were panicking about just a few minutes ago," which gives her a bit of shock, which also shuts her up.

In no time, the elevator makes it to a floor that it had traveled down to get to. I wouldn't be surprised if it were underground, where the sun doesn't shine. I wouldn't expect this floor to have any window that would look out. When the doors of the lift open, two large figures stand with their backs to us, right outside. They turn around and to no surprise to me, it's David and William. After finding out the name of the man who carried her, my father-turned-sister drifts to my side. She whispers to me, "That's William?" Honestly, I relate with her experiencing how large a man could be when you're the size of a shorter woman.

"David, William, how are things? How's our suspect?" the Indian man asks as he walks out of the elevator in a somewhat darker hallway that's devoid of any windows. The two of us women walk out of the elevator behind him, feeling a warm floor underneath our feet.

"She's sedated and resting in holding cell five. She has been restrained as ordered," David saw as he walks side by side with the Indian man. I can see a white ribbon of bandage around his arm, possibly to aid the wound he had gotten earlier due to my curiosity. Looking at just the white wrapped around his arm causes me to feel embarrassed and somewhat responsible for his injury.

The three men stop after walking a while and it seems we just arrived at a holding cell. A large metal door installed through the thick concrete wall to our right has a large white "5" painted on it. The Indian man walks over to a panel a meter or two away from the right of the door. He presses a few buttons and light emits from a source in the ceiling. It blinds my eyes and I move out and away from it. It shines on the wall, even the wall and shows an image as if there was a one-way mirror installed in the concrete.

"Can anybody inside see us?" my father-turned-sister asks.

"No. There are no cameras installed outside the cells, so there would be no point in showing an image to any would-be prisoner held inside," William speaks up. The image shows a guard, whose face I recognize as the man who had rescued me from an earthquake-stricken house. I honestly am angry of what he did to us in that driveway. It was rude and unnecessary. But fortunately, he's inside of the cell and not on the side that I'm on. William continues to speak, now addressing the inside of the cell. The guard and even the technician and nurse seem to hear him. "How's she doing?"

"In all honesty, she's doing fine, as if a burning, exploding aircraft crashing into thick jungle wasn't enough to give her at least a scratch," the nurse says.

"What boggles me is what had happened minutes after we got her to the holding cell and restrained her to the bed. I mean, she was a man before this. When she crashed, she was a man, fully, but after getting her to the bed, that man changed almost instantly to a woman," the guard explains.

"You sure? Did he say what his name was?" the Indian man asks.

What is the name of this suspect?

15513123321132232131.content:
"He was uttering a name, but I was unsure if he was shouting his own name or someone else's," the guard said. "He seemed to be partially conscious during the change, which only took a mere ten seconds. He was writhing so much we needed four men just to keep him still or else he'd hurt himself." The guard moves closer to the bed where a woman with dark hair was laying, asleep and restrained pretty much in the same manner me and my sister were minutes prior. A red light envelops much of the bed and it's hard to tell what race the woman is. "As the transformation ended, he was so tired, but managed to say this sentence: I am Tyrone."

My heart jumps and races at the same time, I take a step forward and inadvertently grasp David's uninjured arm while asking, "Did he just say Tyrone?"

My question grabs the attention of everyone, even the guard in the room. "Yes, I think so, miss," the Indian scientist says. "Did you know this Tyrone?"

The guard turns around and looks at the five of us as if he can see right through the walls. I look up at David, who gently removes his arm from my hand, and then back at the scientist. I then look forward and answer the question while looking at the guard inside. "He's the one who done this to me and Sonya. Did you find a glove with him?" I ask.

"Who's speaking?" the guard asks.

"She's one of the three women who were brought here after the accident," the scientist tells him. The guard bows his head as if in thought and then he walks to the door. He opens it, letting out a pressurized hiss and walks out, closing the door behind him with another pressurized hiss. Knowing that he was the very one who had carried me out of the house and in the driveway, knocked me out very proficiently, I get scared of his presence with us in the hallway. I again take a hold of David's arm and hide behind him. The guard gets a good look of my face and then turns to look at my father-turned-sister.

"Before I say anything else, I'd like to tell the two ladies here that I'm deeply sorry that me and a colleague of mine had to knock you out in that manner. I understand if you're a bit standoff-ish, but I am not here to hurt you. In fact, to answer your question, miss, he... she, i mean, did not have a glove on her person. Nor did she have it in the aircraft. If she did, then it would have burned up to smithereens," the guard explains after apologizing. Not one to trust someone so easily, I still keep my distance from him while hiding behind David. I don't even notice him getting annoyed by the gesture.

"That doesn't explain how this woman here was instantly turned from a male to a female and even in contact with four other males," the scientist puts out. "Like, how doesn't this 'glove' transform people?"

"Somebody wears it and the one that will be transformed has to be slapped in order for the glove to transform them. They even say what the addition or subtraction is before the slap," I tell him to the best of my ability.

"Like an incantation, a chant or magic word?" the guard asks.

"Something like that, but I've seen it done without anything being spoken," I tell him.

"That's how I was transformed," my father-turned-sister adds.

A long silence ensues amongst the six of us. The Indian scientist breaks the silence, suggesting, "You two must be tired from your ordeal. You've been through a lot the past couple of days. Why don't we have David and William here escort you back to your room so you can rest. We'll keep Tyrone or whatever her name is now here. She is still under guard in case she turns violent again."

I nod again and once more, David gently removes his arm from my grasp. His silent annoyance passes under the radar as I'm totally ignorant of the fact and he briskly meets with William who proceeds to the lead the way back to the elevator. I meet up with my father-turned-sister and follow the two men back into the waiting elevator. The ride back up is mostly silent and uneventful, mostly because I have a lot of my mind, mostly regarding the current state of Tyrone and guesses of how he came to be a woman so suddenly. Questions such as, who had slapped Tyrone and in what way was he transformed? Could the glove be as specific as time or circumstance? Where is Tyrone's dad or where is Carlos and his father?

I stay silent until we get to the floor where our room is located. I get to the door, but I stop in my tracks. I feel an emotion that I have never felt before and I tried hard to suppress it. I space out as my mind races and it's only when I hear David's voice accompanied by him tapping my shoulder with his two fingers that I come out of my reverie.

"Are you okay?" he asks. "Anything on your mind?"

What should I ask?

A woman's voice enters my ears amid the heavy footsteps, one from boots and another from a pair of heels. The voice is somewhat assuring, as if the woman senses my distress at this moment. "Do not worry my dear, we are not here to hurt you nor punish you," the woman tells me. She rounds my body and walks into the light in front of me. She's a woman around my mother's age, but with a figure that rivals models in their twenties. She wears a business suit with a blazer and dress shirt with no tie and a pair of business slacks. Her platinum blonde hair is neatly tied in a bun behind her head. "We are here to marvel in an unbelievable feat and possibly employ you because of it."

"Unbelievable?" I ask.

"Unbelievable... yes, unbelievable. You and your sister have dangerous levels of radiations in and on your bodies, level that can have dangerous mutative effects. But what's unbelievable is that you have already mutated," the woman explains and when she is done, I feel a hand, much larger than this woman's, holding my arm and running along it from wrist to shoulder. I shudder, but the woman reassures me. "Don't worry, my dear. He is but your handler, Derrick. Why don't you introduce yourself to your charge?"

The hand leaves my arm and I sense a large presence round the other side of me. A large shadow initially is silhouette by the light, but as he walks underneath it, I can see his face and muscular figure. Arms so thick with strong sinews, I believe he can break a weak woman's body like mine like a twig. He looks into my eyes and without saying a word, nods at me.

"We already know about the glove and it has been taken care of, along with the perpetrators. But you and your sister do not belong in that category. We initially were going to punish you, but after seeing what this godlike garment could accomplish, we had a change of heart," the woman tells me and after finishing, walks forward until I'm face to face with her. She lifts her hand and traces a finger down my arm, from wrist to armpit, the latter which when touched, I momentarily shudder. Her finger leaves my body, only to have the opposite hand liberally take hold of one of my breasts. I can't help but gasp at the gesture and groan and moan as the tender flesh is kneaded and squeezed. Again her hand leaves my body and she continues to speak. "It's fascinating how a male body, born a man, feeling like one, could instantly change into a woman with all the sensations of one." She takes her finger again and traces above the garment I'm wearing, pressing down with enough pressure that I can feel it, making a straight line to the bottom hem of the nightie. "Fascinating that you can feel everything I can certainly feel, with no boundaries to your sensation. You feel..." as she speaks, her finger lightly touches along the sensitive folds of my pussy. The contact causes me to moan and I accidentally looks at Derrick's face. He looks back momentarily with no desire to watch and he almost embarrassingly turns his head aside. "...everything."

Her finger leaves my body for the last time and she walks back to stand right next to Derrick. "Given this opportunity to get to know your charge, we'd like to employ you. There is a truth you must face. As you are these women, you are no longer the men you once were. Your bank accounts, your identity, even your credit is no more. We cannot simply let you two roam free with no identities. If given the chance, people who wish for two unclaimed vessel would claim you and use you in a heartbeat. We'd like to strike two birds with one stone. There are certain people we cannot get close to due to our involvement in the military or law enforcement. As you are employed in secret, you will act the part of not being part of the two and easily gain entry to places an officer or solider has not been in without bashing the door down," she tells me, again walking up to me. "You, my dear, have been given your first assignment. Your handler here will inform you of the details."

With that, the woman leaves the room, leaving me and my handler, Derrick, alone in the room. He looks at my face without glancing anywhere else. But his stare is like those of a predator. His face is stoic, showing little emotion. He walks towards me and then rounds my body until he is behind me. I feel his hand undo the tight rope binding my wrists together. When I wake up, I find laying on Tyrone's bed. Since knowing it was hot inside the house, Tyrone somehow has left the cover off of me. There is no one else in the room other than myself. It's when I open the door to the rest of the house, I find other people. Who are the people beyond the door?

155311.content:

Once the fabric of the glove made contact with my face, it sensed my desire in what was probably a split second and changed me accordingly. In the mirror, I do not find my old self as Cesar. In the mirror, the reflection smiling back at me is what I had desired from the glove. My hand makes contact, causing my palm and fingers to sting due to the sheer force I slapped the guy. The man is knocked off balance, but he keeps his footing. 15531132.content:
The man before me favors the cheek that I just slapped and I'm immediately apologetic when I recognize his face. It's none other than my older brother. Well, more like step-brother, but brother nonetheless. “Oh, I'm sorry, I thought you were somebody else,” I tell him, giving my lame excuse.

“No, no, it's me who's sorry. I thought you were someone, but I was mistaken. It's your hair, it's similar to my friend's,” he says, letting me off the hook. “Say, you wouldn't know where I can find Tyrone, would you?”

“I'm looking for him, too,” I tell him, this time truth rather than a lie.

“There's a lot of people at this party, hard to get around and check,” my step-brother mentions. Heck, I did not know there would be a lot of people at this party either, considering the amount of people my roommates know combined. “I don't know if you can help me, but I'm just looking for my brother. His name is Cesar and he lives with Tyrone.”

I'm caught without an answer, though the truth of where his brother is lies with me. Fuck, I am his brother, just not in the male body anymore. I don't know how he would react if he found out that his brother stands before him with no manhood and a part of chest ornaments. What should I do?

155311321.content:
“I don't know Cesar that well, but I do know where his room is,” I tell him. “It's just right here.” Before I know it, I find myself leading him down the open hallway to the bedrooms. At the T-intersection where straight ahead is a powder room and to the right is Carlos and the former Sonny's bedroom, where a few couples are enjoying the quiet away from the loud living room, I hang a left, where my former self's room is.

I open the door and luckily find that no one has entered the room so when we enter, it's just me and my older step-brother. I walk in taking in the fact that unlike me, my room has stayed the same, the walls and furniture shouting out the testosterone that I no longer have high levels of. There is nothing that tells that Cesar has changed into the girl who is now standing in this room.

I turn around and apologize, “I'm sorry, I figured he would be here.” Just saying that makes me feel guilty for lying to my step-brother, but I manage to keep the truth from spilling out of my mouth.

“Don't be, he's probably somewhere else,” he says, though I sense how melancholic it sounds. He turns to walk towards the open door, but my guilt takes a hold of me and I rush to get between him and the door. I manage to get past him and closed the door behind my back at the cost of hitting him with my arm. “Hey! Girl, I'm not here to enjoy the party, I'm just looking for my brother.”

“Sorry, but I know exactly where he is,” I blurt out.

“You do, don't you?” he asks in doubt. “Where is he then?”

“He's here,” I tell him, but the face he gives me tells me he is confused. “I'm your brother, Jake.”

He is not quick to believe a girl with long brown hair with a top that exposes much of her midriff. “I'm not here to play games, miss. I'm just here to look for my brother, so if you can just tell me where he is--” he explains his intentions, but I cut him off, reiterating my answer.

“I told you he's here. I'm Cesar, Jake,” I say, confidently, but his face reads as obvious disbelief. “I know you don't believe me, but it's true. You won't find Cesar anywhere else at this house, because I'm him. And I can prove it you.”

“Oh yeah, how can you prove that you're my brother, girl?” he asks.

How should I prove to him that I'm his brother and not just a girl?

155312.title: Just My Roommates

info.brief_description: My friend says his glove could slap whatever out of someone. I didn't believe him.
info.description:
One day, one of my roommates came home saying he found this glove, but as he was describing it, I knew he got it from someone. How much is still a mystery. He says that it was an ordinary glove, but with a special power attributed to it. He says that he can slap whatever he wanted out of someone.

He tested it out on a homeless guy not far from where he got it. He simply said, "I'll slap the sense out of you!" That made the homeless dude pretty mad and in his rage, got up and tried to start a fight. My friend says he got a good punch from the guy, but he slapped him with his gloved hand and all of a sudden, the guy went stupid. The vagrant simply stopped fighting and walked into the street, right in the path of a bus! And here's my friend saying he caused that. He should turn himself in, knowing the power he had.

He also tells me this glove can add stuff to people, not just subtract things from them. He came across this girl with a flat butt. He said to her, "I'll slap some ass into that ass!" The girl was mad at first, since he had touched her inappropriately, but she quickly calmed down seeing that he flat butt had volume, had curves, had that tushy quality.

And here he is, trying to get me to believe him, which I don't. He's probably making it up. Boy, was I wrong.
info.pretty_title: The Glove I Hate (And Sometimes Love)
